value.Name: Extreme Measures
value.Description:
Extreme Measures is a student-directed co-ed a cappella group, with nineteen diverse members. Majors and interests range from Theatre to Neuroscience, from community service to creative writing. In a very short time, the group has made incredible strides, performing shows every quarter, recording three studio-produced albums, and performing at events around Chicago! Our latest album, Electric Blue is on iTunes and Spotify, and a new album is in the works this school year!

First and foremost, EM is a group of friends who happen to make music together! We take great pride in our musical talents, and in our ability to have fun with performing and rehearsing. In addition to producing its own shows, EM performs at charity and fundraising events on campus and in the greater Chicago area.  We have even traveled as far as Montreal to sing and tour around!

EM owes all of its success to the dedication of its members; group members arrange all of the music we perform and serve on the executive board to manage finances and show production. Our repertoire is incredibly diverse, and includes artists ranging from Billy Joel to Rihanna to Lady Gaga.

Our goal is to continue growing and maturing as much as we have over the past couple of years, and we hope to see you at our next show and at auditions in the fall!
value.Summary: Extreme Measures is a co-ed a cappella group founded in 2007. In addition to producing its own shows and performing around campus and Chicago, EM has recorded three full studio albums, all available on iTunes and Spotify!

value.Name: Faith-Hope-Love Fellowship
value.Description:
We are a community for Chinese-speaking students who follow Jesus Christ as Savior and/or who are interested in studying the Bible. We hold weekly fellowships during which we worship God, read the Bible, and pray together. Every year, we also hold special events to celebrate Chinese New Year, to explore nature, to welcome new students, and to serve the neighborhood. 

Fellowship Location: TGS commons (2122 Sheridan Rd, RM #140)

Time: Every Saturday 5:30pm - 8:30pm (dinner provided)

Subscribe to our monthly newsletter here!
value.Summary: We are a community of Chinese-speaking students who follow Jesus Christ as Savior and/or who are interested in getting familiar with the Bible in order to witness the gospel of Jesus Christ.

value.Name: Fencing
value.Description:
Northwestern's Club Fencing Team is a recreational team open to both experienced and beginning fencers. We have a travel team open to all who are interested, that competes intercollegiately. We have a top notch coaching staff and equipment will be provided to those who need it. Currently, all of our practice take place in Patten Gymnasium. Our Practice schedule is as follows:

Tuesday 6:30pm-8:30pm Whole Team Footwork + Practice

Thursday 6:30pm-8:30pm Whole Team Footwork + Practice

Our instagram is @nuclubfencing. Contact alisha.shah@northwestern.edu or heatherhumbert2023@u.northwestern.edu with questions.
value.Summary: Northwestern's Club Fencing Team is an intercollegiate competitive team open to both experienced and beginning fencers. We have a top notch coaching staff and equipment will be provided to those who need it. Practice is held in Patten Gym.

value.Name: Fiedler Hillel Student Life
value.Description: Welcome to Northwestern Hillel, the foundation for Jewish life on campus, where Jewish life on campus is vibrant, engaging and exciting. Hillel encompasses a vast number of student groups and initiatives, including Wildcats for Israel, JStreet, First Year Student at Hillel (FYSH) and the Mega Shabbat Committee. The Speakers Committee has helped bring entertaining speakers such as Sarah Silverman and Andy Samberg to campus. In addition, everyone is always welcome for services and free Friday Night Dinner and meals and services during the Holidays. Hillel also transports students around the world through trips to Israel on Birthright and ASB trips with destinations that have included Poland, Morocco, and Brazil. Visit our website at www.northwesternhillel.org.
value.Summary: Welcome to Fiedler Hillel at Northwestern University, the foundation for Jewish life on campus, where Jewish life on campus is vibrant, engaging and exciting. Hillel encompasses a vast number of student groups and initiatives.

value.Name: Financial Technologies Club
value.Description: NU Financial Technologies Club explores the realms of business software, quantitative finance, and general fintech through speakers, simulating projects, and workshops. At present NUFT is developing a simulation hedge fund on an entirely in-house platform, as well as a variety of other initiatives to drive fintech education at Northwestern.
value.Summary: NUFT provides pre-professional opportunities, hands-on collaborative projects, and general information to members of the Northwestern community interested in the Financial Technologies Space.

value.Name: For Members Only
value.Description:
For Members Only (FMO) serves as Northwestern University's premier Black Student Alliance. FMO serves to encourage political, social, cultural and intellectual unity and growth first and foremost within Northwestern University's Black community, but also within the broader Northwestern community as well. FMO is the representative and political voice of Northwestern University's Black undergraduate student body.

 

FMO sponsors a Freshman Mentoring Program, hosts a Spring Concert, Fall Speaker, and various other cultural and community-building events throughout the year! Come out and join us for General Meetings, events, and time at the Black House (1914 Sheridan Road).
value.Summary: For Members Only (FMO) serves as Northwestern University's premier Black Student Union. FMO serves to encourage political, social, cultural and intellectual unity and growth first and foremost within Northwestern University's Black community.

value.Name: Form & Function Marketing
value.Description:
Form & Function, Northwestern University’s first student-run marketing agency, was founded in 2010 to support students’ marketing and advertising education in the absence of an official undergraduate marketing major. F&F gives students the opportunity to gain experience in a variety of marketing functions, building their strategic and creative skill sets, by working with clients in the Chicagoland area and beyond.

Our mission is twofold: to create professional campaigns that drive business impact for our clients and to provide Northwestern students with an applied marketing education and community.
value.Summary: F&F Marketing is Northwestern University's first student-run marketing agency, providing all of the services and resources of a modern marketing agency to businesses in the Evanston/Chicago area and giving students valuable marketing work experience.

value.Name: Freshman Fifteen
value.Description: Northwestern’s premier all-bowling A Cappella group, Freshman Fifteen, is 25 years old and still growing!  Officially founded in 1998, the group does not consist of 15 members nor are they all Freshmen. And yet, the name struck a cord with the founders back in ’98 and has stuck ever since.  Around campus, the group is known for its energy and enthusiasm, as well as each individual member sporting a green bowling shirt with their own personal nickname embroidered on the lefthand pocket. Each member is dubbed a nickname during their first year in the group when they say something “stupid and memorable.” Nicknames range anywhere from “Hip-hoppopotamus” to “Neil Armstrong” to “Underpants.”  Freshman Fifteen has 7 albums; their latest, ILU, came out in 2018. Check them out on Apple Music or Spotify! They perform all over Northwestern's campus and the world, including as the entertainment for Universal Studios’ Holiday Festival in Florida, and in recent years in Punta Cana over winter break!
value.Summary: Northwestern's premier all-bowling a cappella group that isn't all freshman and does not always have 15 people.

value.Name: Freshman Musical
value.Description: The Freshman Musical works to provide barrier-free opportunities for any first-year student, with or without prior experience, to learn about the magic and power of theater. Through a production created entirely by the freshman class, we welcome and encourage students to explore their creative interests in any part of the production process. Our show aims to strengthen and celebrate the freshman community as well as the presence of performing arts on campus.
value.Summary: A musical annually produced entirely by the freshman class.

value.Name: Fusion Dance Company
value.Description:
Fusion Dance Company is a collegiate dance company at Northwestern University founded in 2003. Building on our common passion for dance and our diverse backgrounds, our members come together to grow as artists, a company, and a tight-knit family. Our choreography pulls from many styles and our goal is to foster community on campus while also participating in the Chicago dance scene. We dance for the love it spreads and we are so excited to share that with you!

 

Throughout the year, we perform at events like ReFusionShaka, our own Spring show, and various gigs. Fusion has our sights set on competing in the near future, having been accepted to Prelude Midwest 2020 (cancelled due to Covid). We take inspiration from many styles of dance in our choreography, including but not limited to hip-hop, popping, waacking, jazz, and contemporary.

 

If you have any questions please contact us through fusiondancecompany@u.northwestern.edu, message us on Facebook (Fusion Dance Company - Northwestern) or Instagram (@fusiondanceco_nu).

https://youtu.be/gfWnTKjzrnc
value.Summary: Founded in 2003, Fusion Dance Company is a collegiate dance company composed of around 40 dancers, all of whom come from a variety of dance backgrounds and life experiences. We dance for the love it spreads and we are so excited to share that with you!

value.Name: Gamma Sigma Alpha
value.Description: The Beta Tau chapter of Gamma Sigma Alpha (founded in 1995) National Academic Greek Honor Society (GSA) is the premier organization committed to the academic success of our members and alignment with the academic missions of our host institutions. Students with Junior or Senior status and a 3.65 GPA are eligible for membership in Gamma Sigma Alpha. Applications are available in Fall and Spring quarter.
value.Summary: The Beta Tau chapter of Gamma Sigma Alpha (founded in 1995) National  Academic Greek Honor Society (GSA) is the premier organization committed  to the academic success of our members and alignment with the academic  missions of our host institutions.

value.Name: Gender and Sexuality Resource Center
value.Summary: GSRC is located on the third floor of Norris University Center.

value.Name: Get-A-Grip
value.Description: Get-A-Grip is a project-based program that challenges middle school students to design and construct a prosthetic arm using low-cost, readily-available materials.
value.Summary: Get-A-Grip is a project-based program that challenges middle school students to design and construct a prosthetic arm using low-cost, readily-available materials.

value.Name: Girl Up at Northwestern
value.Description:
In order to support its mission, Girl Up NU takes a three-pronged approach through advocacy, awareness, and fundraising. By lobbying for girls' rights to congressional leaders, launching widespread campaigns to boost awareness, and hosting fundraisers to support on-the-ground programs, Girl Up NU actively manifests its mission throughout the school year. While each individual sector is important, Girl Up NU believes that together, all three categories have the potential to create the most effective change.

Moreover, because these issues are oceans away from Northwestern University, Girl Up NU utilizes a unique community development model in order to stay connected to its mission in a hands-on way. Examples of community engagement that Girl Up NU practices include inviting girls from RefugeeOne to campus and inviting Girl Scout troupes to learn about sustainability, culminating with an educational summit for middle school girls at Northwestern University in the spring. In addition to our Community Development committee, members can be involved in our Campus Events committee that invites speakers and plans an annual 5K among other activities. 

Our organization promotes intersectional feminism and gender equality. We welcome any student who wishes to join, regardless of gender identity. We have no general membership application and have several executive board positions such as the Community Development Co-Chair, Public Relations Chair, Treasurer, and Campus Events Co-Chair.

We meet weekly in the Women's Center. Feel free to come any time during the school year (we have new people join throughout the year!). We will likely have an information session the first/second week of the each quarter, or find us at the Student Organization Fair!

 

Please email girlup@u.northwestern.edu if you have any questions and/or to join the listerv. 

Follow and like our page on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/girl_up_nu/
value.Summary: Girl Up NU is a campus chapter of the UN Foundation's Girl Up campaign which promotes the education, leadership, and well-being of girls in our community and in developing countries around the world. We meet weekly in the Women's Center.

value.Name: Global Brigades
value.Description: Global Brigades (GB) is the largest, student-led, nonprofit health and sustainable development organization with varied membership that spans North American and European universities. Participating student and professional volunteers empower communities in developing countries with sustainable solutions that improve quality of life and environment, while respecting local culture. This is Northwestern's chapter of Global Brigades.
value.Summary: Global Brigades is a sustainable development and health organization that works to empower international communities to provide better quality of life through various programs.

value.Name: Global Engagement Summit
value.Description: The Global Engagement Summit brings together students interested in global affairs, entrepreneurship, current events, and social justice to plan a week-long innovation conference. The conference hosts 30 international entrepreneurs—from Nigeria, to Indonesia, to the Northwestern community itself— to work on their change-based projects that can tackle any social change from education to healthcare to sustainability. Previous projects include a solution to deforestation in Sudan and a mental health initiative for Armenian veterans. This org is a fun way to meet like-minded people who are passionate about making a difference in the world through entrepreneurship and creative problem-solving.
value.Summary: The Global Engagement Summit (GES) is a student-led community of changemakers that values engaging with the world in meaningful ways. A core part of what we do is organize an annual social innovation conference for entrepreneurs from all over the world.

value.Name: Global Medical Missions Alliance
value.Description:
We are a group of students and healthcare professionals who seek to build one another up in Christ, and become better equipped for missions both in our local community and globally. 

We engage in activities such as:

  • Campus Outreach
  • Local Community Medical Outreach
  • Global Missions Outreach
  • Biannual National Conferences
  • Partnering with various chapters across the country
  • Partnering with medical professionals and hosting health panels and related mentorship events
value.Summary:
Our mission is to bring God’s healing to all nations.
“Arise, shine, for your light has come, and the glory of the Lord rises upon you.” Isaiah 60:1

value.Name: Global Research and Consulting
value.Description: Global Research and Consulting Group (GRC) is looking for hardworking, driven people to join our team this Fall. GRC works with social impact businesses and NGOs across the globe to help them achieve their goals, while simultaneously inspiring students to give back to the global community and develop their skills. We have a presence across the globe, with chapters at Harvard, Stanford, Oxford, Cambridge, and Yale, among others. Here is the link to GRC Global's website: https://www.grcglobalgroup.com/
value.Summary: Global Research and Consulting Group (GRC) works with social impact organizations and NGOs across the globe to help them achieve their goals while simultaneously inspiring students to give back to the global community and develop their skills.

value.Name: GlobeMed
value.Description:
GlobeMed was started at Northwestern University with the mission to enhance the way college students strive to improve the health and living conditions of poverty. Historically, grassroots leaders across the world have initiated projects aimed at increasing the standard of life in their communities. These leaders are born and raised in the communities they serve, possessing the knowledge, relationships, and vision necessary to foster impactful and lasting change. These initiatives, however, often lack crucial resources including funding, technology, research, and global recognition needed to realize their potential.

 

     The current partner of Northwestern GlobeMed is the Adonai Child Development Centre in Namugoga, Uganda. Adonai provides for the needs of children orphaned by AIDS and the extended civil unrest in the northern and eastern parts of Uganda. Through yearly fundraising campaigns, we supply financial resources for Adonai. Additionally, each summer three to four students are selected to participate on the GROW trip at the Adonai Centre. There, they collaborate with Adonai Executive Directors Aloysious and Abby Luswata along with members of the local community on sustainable, capacity building projects. Previous projects included the medical centre, safe water project, an electronic data system for their records, and a community needs assessment on existing health infrastructures, water and sanitation, and reusable energy needs of the community. 

 

     Back on campus, we hold weekly global health themed meetings to discuss current issues and allow our members to think critically in a low-stress, safe environment. Our mission is to create a sustainable impact on the health of our partner community as well as inspire and train the next generation of global health leaders. If you are interested in joining our community, recruitment is early Fall Quarter. For more information, check out our website (https://sites.northwestern.edu/globemed/), FB page (GlobeMed at Northwestern), instagram (@globemednu), email us at northwestern@globemed.org!
value.Summary: GlobeMed presents an opportunity for students to contextualize healthcare inequity in a low-stress, non-academic setting. Uniting students from varying backgrounds, GlobeMed fosters a safe space for discussion on global health and social justice issues.

value.Name: Go Club
value.Summary: N/A

value.Name: Graduate Christian Fellowship
value.Description:
Our official website is here: http://studentorgs.northwestern.edu/gcf/

Please subscribe to our listserv or email gcf@u.northwestern.edu to receive updates about large groups, retreats, and other announcements. In addition, please fill out fill out this short Google form.

We are a community of graduate students encouraging faith-work integration; and spiritual exploration, dialogue, and development by engaging our campus and city.

We are an affiliate of InterVarsity Christian Fellowship, part of a worldwide network of Evangelical student organizations.
value.Summary: The Graduate Christian Fellowship is a community of Christian graduate and professional students. We also provide spaces for skeptics to discuss religion and its connection to contemporary life. Our website is here: studentorgs.northwestern.edu/gcf

value.Name: Graduate International Student Association
value.Summary: To foster greater cross-cultural understanding by promoting interaction, providing information and ensuring inclusion for and by the graduate international community of Northwestern University.

value.Name: Graduate Investment Club
value.Description: GIC is a student group that enables graduate students to gain exposure to investing. GIC members are interested in various ways to allocate capital to create returns. GIC welcomes graduate students interested in public and private markets, wealth management and impact investing, and various other forms of investment. Pursuing its purpose, GIC engages in a broad range of activities including member presentations on various topics about investing and guest talks with industry leaders.
value.Summary: GIC is a student group that enables graduate students to gain exposure to investing. Pursuing its purpose, GIC engages in a broad range of activities including member presentations on various topics about investing and guest talks with industry leaders.

value.Name: Graduate Leadership Advocacy Council
value.Description: The Graduate Leadership Advocacy Council's mission and purpose is multifold.  Our primary purpose is to act as a liaison between graduate student organizations and leaders, and The Graduate School (TGS) administration.  We also serve to open the lines of communication between graduate student groups across campus, serving as a forum for student leaders to share best practices.  GLAC also works to collect information from the graduate students represented by TGS to report on graduate student life to the Northwestern board of trustees.  Finally, GLAC serves at the NU representation at the National Association of Graduate-Professional Students (NAGPS).
value.Summary: The mission of the Graduate Leadership and Advocacy Council (GLAC) is to advocate on behalf of TGS graduate students and graduate student organizations to the Graduate School (TGS) and Northwestern University.

value.Name: Graduate Society of Women Engineers
value.Description: The Society of Women Engineers (SWE) is a nationally recognized professional, educational, non-profit, and service organization dedicated to encouraging women to pursue STEM fields. The Northwestern SWE (NU SWE) chapter’s (est. 1976) original emphasis was on undergraduates. In the last decade, the need for a dedicated group targeting the interests of graduate women led to the establishment of GradSWE in 2012. As interest continued to grow, GradSWE formed an executive board of 8-10 people to coordinate social, professional development, and mentoring events to meet the needs of the graduate women community. GradSWE includes female and male graduate students across all STEM disciplines at NU who advocate for the participation and retention of women in STEM at all levels. We organize events such as quarterly lunch discussions and co-host networking events and monthly coffee hours to build support networks and community among graduate women and advocates. Moreover, benefiting from our position in the broader SWE network, we leverage our connections with professional organizations (SWE and Association for Women in Science) in Chicago and NU SWE undergraduates to encourage mentorship and networking between women at all careers stages.
value.Summary: TBA

value.Name: Graduate Student Association
value.Description: The Northwestern Graduate Student Association represents and serves non-professional graduate students at Northwestern University in Evanston and Chicago, IL.  We build community at Northwestern and provide opportunities to serve the greater Evanston and Chicago communities.
value.Summary: The Northwestern Graduate Student Association represents and serves non-professional graduate students at Northwestern University in Evanston and Chicago, IL.

value.Name: Graduate Student Association for Latino and Spanish Activities
value.Description:
Ever wonder how you can get involved in the Latino community at Northwestern?

G-SALSA (Graduate Student Association for Latino and Spanish Activities) was founded with the purpose of providing an  environment where students can meet and interact with other students to celebrate Hispanic and Latin American Heritage.

In other words, ...

We are committed to enjoy graduate student life!

We will work hard to make new friends!

We hope that you will join us in our quest to have fun while we learn in  the process!

Share: We help each other in whatever way we can.

Eat: We go out to restaurants or host events such as Argentinean parillada on the Summer.

Learn: Learn about the Latino American culture and other cultures.

Dance: Dance in salsa clubs.

Soccer: If you would like to play soccer, you can contact us. We organize practice, games and a team for the Intramurlas.

Outdoors: We have visited the Chicago Botanic Garden in summer or the Gardfield Park Conservatory in winter.
value.Summary:
Ever wonder how you can get involved in the Latino community at Northwestern?
G-SALSA (Graduate Student Association for Latino and Spanish Activities) was founded with the purpose of providing an  environment where students can meet and interact

value.Name: Graduate Women Across Northwestern
value.Description: Graduate Women Across Northwestern (GWAN) is an interdisciplinary organization that seeks to create community building opportunities for women in the graduate and professional programs at Northwestern University in Evanston, Illinois. GWAN was founded in the fall of 2006 through the Northwestern Kellogg School of Management’s Women’s Business Association. We are funded by a Community Building Grant through The Graduate School.
value.Summary: GWAN is an interdisciplinary organization dedicated to providing community building opportunities for women graduate and professional students at NU.

value.Name: Graffiti Dancers
value.Description:
Graffiti Dancers is Northwestern University's oldest and most eclectic dance ensemble. After over four decades of performing and choreographing, Graffiti continues to create exciting and boundary-pushing dance, attracting large audiences to entertain and inspire. Using the mediums and cross-sections of jazz, modern, and ballet, Graffiti has created innovative pieces ranging from satirical contemporary ballet, to political dance-theater, to entertaining jazz. Graffiti continues to produce high-energy shows filled with all forms of dance, entertaining, provoking, challenging, and inspiring each member of our company and each member of our audience.

Graffiti Dancers is a completely student-run dance company, meaning we, and all that we do, are directed, produced, choreographed, designed, and performed by students. We typically have 15-18 dancers, most of whom have extensive training and experience in ballet, jazz, modern, contemporary, and hip-hop. Though not everyone has experience in all of these dance forms, every dancer has his or her own strengths. These diverse strengths are what make us one of the most versatile dance groups on campus, providing the company with unique and individual voices that integrate into one community and allow us to connect with a broad audience through our performances.
value.Summary: Graffiti Dancers is a not-for-profit, student-run organization, and the premier contemporary dance company at Northwestern University. After four decades, Graffiti continues to create unique choreographic work at NU.

value.Name: Griffin's Tale Children's Theatre Repertory Company
value.Description: We are Griffin's Tale, Northwestern University's only Children's Repertory Theatre Company!  We take stories and poems written by kids in the Evanston and Chicago areas and turn them into skits, sketches, songs, raps, dances, and more!  THEN we get to go to the schools these amazing students attend and perform their stories for them!  We've been doing it since 1989, and we love it!
value.Summary: We are Griffin's Tale, Northwestern University's only Children's Repertory Theatre Company!  We take stories and poems written by kids in the Evanston and Chicago areas and turn them into skits, sketches, songs, raps, dances, and more!

value.Name: Grounding for Public Service
value.Description:
Grounding for Public Service (GPS) Club is a weekly learning and connecting space focused on social justice and equity education in Evanston and Chicago.  

GPS Club engages students in learning about the Evanston and Chicago community, including physical environment, local culture, history, and people. We focus on growing our knowledge of Evanston and Chicago through a racial justice and equity lens. The goal is to build a community of informed and engaged citizens. 

We meet every Tuesday at Parkes Hall from 5:00-6:30 pm for dinner and learning. Please visit our website for more information! All are welcome!
value.Summary: Grounding for Public Service is a student-led group under LDCE dedicated to social justice education and building relationships with one another.

value.Name: Habitat for Humanity
value.Description: Habitat For Humanity is an organization dedicated to providing decent housing to deserving, low-income families. Our ultimate goal is to eliminate poverty nationally and globally. Our group maintains a focus on volunteerism and fundraising, helping to buy the materials needed to build a house and providing the labor necessary to put it together. As a volunteer, you will work alongside other Northwestern students, led by a trained site leader, at different sites in the Chicagoland area. NO CONSTRUCTION EXPERIENCE IS NECESSARY! Our work ranges from building houses with our affiliates, Habitat For Humanity of Lake County and Northern Fox Valley, to weatherizing homes for the elderly with H.O.M.E. and partnering with other local organizations to help those in need of improved housing.
value.Summary: Habitat for Humanity is an organization dedicated to providing decent housing to deserving, low-income families. Our group maintains a focus on volunteerism, fundraising and having fun doing it.

value.Name: Happiness Club
value.Description:
Do you think that if you make someone happy, you will be happy too?

Do you want to do more of what makes you happy?

What do you think of a club dedicated to puppies, candy, balloons, bubbles, sunshine, and smiley faces? Because that's what Happiness Club is, and that's what we do! We try to make everyone at Northwestern smile a little wider and a little more often by putting on fun, free events and creating the moments that make you think, "That just made my day!"

Join Happiness Club!
value.Summary: Happiness Club is a student group at Northwestern University committed to increasing the happiness of members of the Northwestern community. How do we do this? Through fun and exciting activities!

value.Name: Harmony for Healing
value.Description: tba
value.Summary: tba

value.Name: Helicon
value.Description: HELICON was the brainchild of three students in Mary Kinzie’s 1979 poetry sequence.  Lisa Getter, Christina Calvit, and Michael Steele wanted to provide Northwestern with a regularly published literary magazine that could showcase the artistic work of the student body. HELICON began in Chapin, the Humanities Residential College, and is funded by the Residential College Program through the Office of the Provost.  We publish twice a year, with a print issue in the Winter and a web issue (with online supplement) in the Spring. Throughout the year, we hold events including open mics and writing workshops.
value.Summary: HELICON is Northwestern's premier literary and arts magazine. We publish the best in student art twice a year, with submissions ranging from poetry and prose to music and videos to comic books and visual art. Visit helicon.northwestern.edu for more info.

value.Name: HerCampus
value.Description: We publish weekly articles about entertainment, beauty, news, health and lifestyle as it pertains to college women. Members are encouraged to pitch ideas based on their interests and contribute to a female affinity space on campus.
value.Summary: We are an online newsmagazine and digital brand tailored towards Northwestern women. We provide a platform for students to write online articles and get to know one another through bonding events. All are welcome, regardless prior journalism experience!

value.Name: Hindu YUVA
value.Description:
Hindu YUVA aims to organize activities for community service in the spirit of Sewa (Hindu conception of service to humanity) and celebrate Hindu festivals. In our weekly meetings, we play traditional team-building games, practice yoga and meditation, and study Hindu scriptures. 

The above initiatives will serve the purpose of creating a vibrant Hindu presence on campus, and will aid in providing a home-away-from-home feeling to incoming and existing Hindu students.
value.Summary: Hindu YUVA aims to provide a platform to preserve, practice, promote, and protect Hindu Dharma by bringing together Hindu community on campus.

value.Name: Hispanic Finance Association
value.Description: tba
value.Summary: tba

value.Name: Hobart House
value.Summary: Hobart House is on south campus and houses 50 women in single-, double-, and triple-occupancy rooms, arranged in a traditional-style layout. This building is available to all female undergraduate students.

value.Name: Homecoming
value.Description: Northwestern University Homecoming complements the academic experience through a variety of cultural, social, community service, and recreational events that celebrate Northwestern Wildcat Pride. Northwestern Homecoming also infuses Purple Pride into Northwestern students, faculty, staff, alumni, and Evanston community members, thereby strengthening and unifying the greater Northwestern community yearlong.
value.Summary: Northwestern University Homecoming complements the academic experience through a variety of cultural, social, community service, and recreational events that celebrate Northwestern Wildcat Pride.

value.Name: Hong Kong Student Association
value.Description:
Hong Kong Student Association aims to promote the vibrant and cosmopolitan Hong Kong culture on campus. Given that Hong Kong is one of the most culturally diverse and international cities in the world, we welcome students from all backgrounds to participate in our activities. 

 

Our social and cultural events held throughout the year range from celebrating cultural festivities to doing community service work for marginalized communities in Hong Kong… think dim sum get-togethers, canto karaoke, Wong Kar-wai movie marathons, and much more!

 

Not only are we here to provide support to HK students through peer support and alumni relations, but we’re also open to connecting with prospective HK students.
value.Summary: The Hong Kong Student Association (HKSA) is a cultural organization focused on building a community around the shared love of our city.

value.Name: Hospice Patient Care Club
value.Description:
The purpose of the Hospice Patient Care Club (HPCC) is to provide a group of committed hospice patient care volunteers to the Evanston community, all the while supporting our volunteers to make sure students feel comfortable and confident during their interactions with patients. Through our efforts, we also hope to raise the awareness of hospice and palliative care, as well as hospice volunteering, at Northwestern and connect the student body to the surrounding community in a positive way.

Our primary goal is to see that all hospice patients in the Northwestern area get a friendly face if they want one. That being said, we want HPCC to be a win-win-win for the hospices we connect with, the students who are willing to generously give their time, and the hospice patients who truly benefit from having regular visits. To be Medicare-certified, hospices are required to have volunteer hours comprise at least 5% of their total number of patient care hours. Having a steady stream of volunteers also allows hospices to always provide a hospice patient with their own volunteer, improving the level of care these hospices can provide. From our members' perspectives, each student will be closely involved with their own patient(s). From these experiences, the student will learn both the healthcare responsibilities of being a team's official "Patient Care Hospice Volunteer" and lessons from a human being who naturally becomes a close friend. Regular club meetings will provide support and additional learning opportunities for the students: basic check-ins to make sure students are not stressing themselves out in their kind-hearted efforts, discussions on how they can best serve their patients, inviting guest speakers from the hospices to talk about intriguing and difficult issues in health care, and coverage of transportation costs through ASG funding if applicable.
value.Summary: HPCC looks to provide a group of committed hospice patient care volunteers to the Evanston & greater Chicago community, all the while supporting our volunteers to make sure students feel comfortable and confident during their interactions with patients.

value.Name: Illustrators & Animators Club
value.Description:
Northwestern's #1 illustration club!

We provide educational opportunities about art and the art industry. Here you will find art tutorials, portfolio advice, watch parties, conversations with working professionals in the industry, and all sorts of art challenges like Drawtober and art swaps.

We welcome all levels of experience. Whether you love to doodle, want to start learning to draw, or just want to meet people who share your love of all things animation, this is the place for you!
value.Summary: The Illustrators & Animators Club aims to serve the Northwestern art community by supporting and promoting student artists. This club is open to all. No prior art experience necessary!

value.Name: Impact
value.Summary: We are a Black Christian ministry designed to equip Black students to become spiritual leaders in all areas of their lives. Impact is a loving space for Black students to seek community, while exploring and/or deepening their relationship with God.

value.Name: In Our Nature
value.Description: In Our Nature aims to bring the environment to everyone. Whether you’re a granola guru, environmental justice advocate, a casual recycler or anything in between, our stories, tips and entertainment will bring out your inner treehugger. We look to express love for nature, highlight its importance, bring attention to environmental injustices, and help readers learn more about environmental issues in the Chicagoland area and beyond.
value.Summary: In Our Nature is a student-run, paperless magazine that aims to bring the environment to everyone, and to provide a platform for students of all majors to express care for nature.

value.Name: InclusionNU
value.Description: This page is for administrative use for managers of the InclusionNU Fund to see finances.
value.Summary: The Inclusion NU fund supports campus endeavors that promote inclusion at Northwestern.

value.Name: Indian Graduate Students and Scholars Association
value.Summary: IGSSA aims to serve and foster a sense of community among the the Indian (and larger South Asian) graduate and post-doc population at Northwestern University.

value.Name: Indonesian Students' Association
value.Description: IDSA creates a social environment for students of all backgrounds, and promotes Indonesian culture at Northwestern University. Our club aims to foster a stronger sense of community between our members, and form close relationships with other student organizations by celebrating and sharing the Indonesian identity. We hope that through IDSA, members will have access to professional opportunities and various student resources (e.g. consular services), and that the broader Northwestern community will have a place to learn about Indonesia. Finally, IDSA is a proponent for Northwestern University’s global initiatives, and aims to garner broader recognition as a prestigious institution for higher education among student communities in Indonesia.
value.Summary: IDSA creates a social environment for students of all backgrounds, and promotes Indonesian culture at Northwestern University.

value.Name: Institute for Student Business Education
value.Description:
Northwestern Institute for Student Business Education (ISBE) provides unparalleled education and experiential business opportunities for its members. Visit our website: nuisbe.org

--

Our 7 product groups strive to provide real-world opportunities in consulting, finance, marketing, journalism, entrepreneurship and more. Members of ISBE can expect to learn tangible business skills through engagement with fellow students, ISBE alumni and clients from Evanston / Chicago.

--

All members from ISBE will also have the opportunity to participate in the workshops, office visits, exclusive company networking sessions and more. The members will not only hone their hard skills through projects, but also practice their interpersonal skills through the extensive ISBE alumni network.

--

Above all, with over 150 active members, our mission is to be the leading resource for all Northwestern undergraduates to discover the possibilities of a career in business.
value.Summary: Established in 2005, ISBE is the premier and largest student business group at Northwestern. ISBE consists of 7 product groups and over 200 members. We offer a diverse array of educational and experiential business opportunities.

value.Name: Institute of Industrial and Systems Engineers
value.Summary: The Institute of Industrial and Systems Engineers (IISE) strives to improve the IEMS student experience by fostering community, providing academic & career services, and serving as the department liaison between administration and students

value.Name: Interfraternity Council
value.Description: The Interfraternity Council (IFC) consists of 12 nationally-recognized fraternities at Northwestern. For the past 150 years, IFC fraternities have enriched the lives of students at Northwestern through leadership development, social justice education, and various programming and social activities. Today, more than 1300 individuals are members of IFC fraternities at NU, sharing the sense of community, building long-lasting bonds, and unbreakable friendships.
value.Summary: The Interfraternity Council (IFC) consists of 12 nationally-recognized fraternities at Northwestern. For the past 150 years, IFC fraternities have enriched the lives of students at Northwestern through educational programs and activities.

value.Name: International Student Association
value.Description: ISA seeks to promote interaction among students from different cultural and religious backgrounds and to build a cohesive community of students both from the United States and around the world. ISA serves as a platform to engage with global issues, spread cultural awareness, and voice the concerns and interests of the international and domestic student body.
value.Summary: ISA promotes interaction among students from different cultural backgrounds, serves as a platform through which to engage with global and cultural issues, and hopes to be a "home away from home" for students both from the US and abroad.

value.Name: International Studies Residential College - West Fairchild
value.Description: West Fairchild is home to the International Studies Residential College (ISRC). Located on South Campus, West Fairchild is home to 106 students in single- and double-occupancy rooms, arranged in an open suite-style layout. While residents are organized into suites by gender, ISRC also has an all-gender suite on the 2nd floor. This building is available to all undergraduate students.
value.Summary: West Fairchild is on south campus and houses 106 students in single- and double- occupancy rooms, arranged in an open suite-style layout. Men and women live in suites. This building is available to all undergraduate students.

value.Name: Investment Management Club
value.Summary: Interested in a potential career in investment management?  So are we, join a group that will give you broad exposure to the investment management industry and its professionals.

value.Name: Investment Management Group
value.Description:
Northwestern University Investment Management Group (IMG) is a student run organization dedicated to those who have an interest in investment. The Group seeks to expose students to the investing world by simulating the operations of an asset management firm. Our mandate is to make long term investments in fundamentally great public companies with sustainable competitive advantages and high growth potential. IMG's emphasis on student-led investment education has allowed members to benefit from formal training on finance subjects, mentorship from upperclassmen and alumni, professional development workshops, speaker events, and internship opportunities. 

Please visit NUIMG.org or contact NorthwesternIMG@gmail.com to connect with the Executive Board.
value.Summary: Please visit NUIMG.org

value.Name: Iranian Student Association
value.Description: The Iranian Students Association at Northwestern University is a student group dedicated to promoting social, intellectual and cultural activities for Iranian students and scholars at Northwestern University as well as interested members in the Northwestern community. Besides cultural and social activities, our organization strives to provide opportunities and benefits for its members such as information and support for incoming Iranian students, and connecting current NU students with Iranian NU alumni in order to enhance their experience in NU and expand their career opportunities in the future.
value.Summary: The Iranian Students Association at Northwestern University is a student group dedicated to promoting social, intellectual and cultural activities for Iranian students and scholars.

value.Name: Iranian Students Association
value.Description: The Iranian Students Association at Northwestern University is a student group dedicated to promoting social, intellectual and cultural activities for Iranian students and scholars at Northwestern University as well as interested members in the Northwestern community. Besides these cultural and social activities, our organization strives to provide opportunities and benefits for its members such as information and support for incoming Iranian students, and connecting current NU students with Iranian NU alumni for enhancing their experience in NU and expanding their career opportunities in the future.
value.Summary: The Iranian Students Association at Northwestern University is a student group dedicated to promoting social, intellectual and cultural activities for Iranian students and scholars as well as interested members at the Northwestern University.

value.Name: Italian Association
value.Summary: Open to all interested students, the Italian Association (ITA) aims to establish a foundation upon which to develop and manifest Italian language and culture within the Northwestern community.

value.Name: J Street U Northwestern
value.Description:
J Street U Northwestern is the Northwestern chapter of a nationwide movement of campus groups advocating and educating on colleges and universities for vigorous and sustained American leadership in facilitating a negotiated, two-state resolution to the Israeli-Palestinian conflict.

We know that the fates of both peoples are intertwined.  Advocating for Israel necessitates advocating for Palestinian statehood, and we defend and support the right of both the Jewish and Palestinian peoples to sovereignty and security in democratic, self-governing states.  We recognize that the ongoing occupation and settlement of the Palestinian territories is politically unsustainable and morally untenable.  We envision an Israel and Palestine that respect and guarantee human and civil rights to all their inhabitants, an Israel and Palestine that live at peace along internationally recognized borders, an Israel and Palestine that reflect the promise of Israel's founding declaration — states “based on the precepts of liberty, justice and peace.”

Many of us are students frustrated by a polarized climate on our campuses and a narrow conversation in our politics, where too often blame for the conflict is placed either entirely on Israel or entirely on the Palestinians.  Many of us are Americans inspired by the democratic ideals of freedom, rule of law, and equality.  

We disagree, and we learn a lot from one another. We ask only that our members be willing to listen to each other, and that they bring open minds alongside their personal perspectives.
value.Summary: We are a nationwide movement of campus chapters advocating and educating on colleges and universities for vigorous and sustained American leadership in facilitating a negotiated, two-state resolution to the Israeli-Palestinian conflict.

value.Name: Japan Club
value.Description:
Northwestern Japan Club exists to share a love and appreciation of the Japanese language and culture in a community setting. Our club strives to create an environment within which members of the Northwestern family can learn, share and celebrate Japan and its culture. Our events are recreational and educational so that everyone may be part of the Japan Club family. We aim to serve as a bridge between Northwestern and Japanese communities, both in the US and abroad. We host weekly meetings and numerous events throughout the year, such as movie nights, food socials, game nights, karaokes, and retreats! 


You don't have to be Japanese to join; you don't need to speak Japanese to join. If you have even the smallest interest in Japan or Japanese culture, we strongly encourage you to join! We hope to see you sometime at one of our meetings or events!

Feel free to email us with any questions!
value.Summary: Northwestern Japan Club is an organization that fosters an open and friendly environment for the enjoyment of Japanese culture through a supportive network and community through events and occasions.

value.Name: Japanese American Student Association
value.Description:
JASA is established for the purpose of providing a community for Japanese Americans on campus. JASA provides a safe community for Japanese Americans for them to talk about contemporary issues and topics regarding the Japanese American identity. The organization also provides a platform for Japanese Americans and other interested parties to come together for informal networking. JASA is also meant to educate those within and outside of the Japanese American community about Japanese culture and contemporary issues.

Some events JASA hosts include meetings (discussion based and activity based), field trips, speaker events and co-hosting events with other organizations. 

All members, regardless of background, are invited to join JASA and foster the Japanese American community on campus.
value.Summary: JASA is an organization that creates and fosters a community for Japanese Americans on campus. JASA is also meant to educate those within and outside of the Japanese American community about Japanese culture and contemporary issues.

value.Name: Japanese Graduate Student Association
value.Description: JGSA primarily serves the community of Japanese-identifying graduate students and postdocs alongside their family members across all disciplines and programs. The organization aims to enhance the quality of the graduate student life of this community by 1) Providing an emotional safe space in which Japanese-identifying students/postdocs can feel a sense of belonging, connect, and receive support in times of need, 2) Offering opportunities where members can help each other with academic/professional development to overcome the difficulties of navigating this space as a Japanese-identifying student, 3) Offering opportunities for social activities in which Japanese-identifying students/postdocs can enhance their overall experience in graduate school, and 4) Facilitating the communication between the school administration and the Japanese-identifying community.
value.Summary: JGSA primarily serves the community of Japanese-identifying graduate students and postdocs alongside their family members across all disciplines and programs.

value.Name: Jazz Club
value.Description: The purpose of The Jazz Club is to allow everyone in the Northwestern community the chance to play and experience jazz, regardless of their background and knowledge. Furthermore, The Jazz Club also seeks to actively encourage and accept women, LGBTQ+, and minority jazz musicians (or those who seek to learn), who are often severely underrepresented in college-level jazz organizations. In fostering an inclusive environment, we hope to create a community where anyone can feel comfortable playing and making their voice heard.
value.Summary: The purpose of The Jazz Club is to allow everyone in the Northwestern community the chance to play and experience jazz, regardless of their background and knowledge.

value.Name: Jewish Theatre Ensemble
value.Description: The Jewish Theatre Ensemble is one of the many awesome student theatre boards at NU! JTE's mission is to challenge perceptions of and create conversation about Judaism through theatre. There are many ways to get involved with JTE, including working on or performing in a production, petitioning to be a freshman board representative, pitching a special project, or talking to a few board members! Check us out on Facebook or Instagram @jewishtheatreensemble or www.jewishtheatreensemble.com.
value.Summary: The Jewish Theatre Ensemble is one of NU's student theatre boards. We aim to operate at a level of artistic excellence and support creative endeavors that promote Jewish themes in the arts. We produce three shows a year with many ways to get involved!

value.Name: Juggling Club
value.Description: tba
value.Summary: tba

value.Name: Jumpstart
value.Description: Partnered with under-resourced preschools in the Evanston community, we work to provide children with the literary, language, and social-emotional skills to prepare them for kindergarten. We provide training and opportunities to work with family, faculty, and students in the community.
value.Summary: Book Buddies is in partnership with Evanston Public Library to bring volunteers to preschools in Evanston to promote literacy.

value.Name: K-Dance
value.Description:
Northwestern K-Dance is a student-led K-Pop dance group open to all levels of experience. 

K-Dance works to create a community for all to enjoy K-Pop. K-Dancers may enjoy one of two levels of membership: casual or auditioned. Casual general members are able to enjoy any of our middle pieces performances, bi-weekly dance workshops, socials, YouTube videos, or other events. Those particularly passionate and interested are encouraged to audition for our quarterly performance teams in order to learn the full choreo to a K-Pop song, perform on stage, and have a music video filmed! Past performances have included our own Spring Show and guest appearances at Refusionshaka, CSA's annual Celebrasia and CISA's Lunar New Year event. Please feel free to follow us on Facebook and Instagram and subscribe on YouTube!!
value.Summary: Northwestern K-Dance is a student-led K-Pop dance group open to all levels of experience.

value.Name: Kadima
value.Description:
Kadima is the hub for Jewish social justice on campus! We provide a space for both Jewish and non-Jewish students to become involved with social action. Kadima runs volunteer opportunities, educational workshops, and speaker events based on various social justice issues, including climate change, mental healthcare, housing justice, and more.

 

Our organization strives to promote social justice causes and engage the student population while operating under Jewish values. We will both host events and promote other events with partner organizations to shed light on causes and organizations that deserve it. While we are a Jewish group, students of all faiths are welcome to attend and join in Kadima, understanding and respecting the Jewish identity held by the organization.
value.Summary: Kadima is the hub for Jewish social justice on campus! We provide opportunities for both Jewish and non-Jewish students to get involved with volunteer opportunities, educational workshops, and speaker events based on various social justice issues.

value.Name: Kaibigan: Philippine-American Student Association
value.Description: Kaibigan is a Northwestern student-run organization dedicated to promoting Philippine culture through education and exposure. Kaibigan means "friend" in Filipino. The group fosters a sense of community providing a reliable and supportive environment for its members. We host a variety of events throughout the year such as Filipinx Fiesta, where we provide free Philippine food and teach attendees dances, as well as our biggest event Pinoy Show which is our annual cultural show that involves cultural and modern dances, skits, student-made videos, live music, and more.
value.Summary: Kaibigan is a Northwestern student-run organization dedicated to promoting Philippine and Philippine-American culture through education and exposure. The group fosters a sense of community providing a reliable and supportive environment for its members.

value.Name: Kappa Delta Chi Sorority, Inc.
value.Description:
Purpose:
The purpose of Kappa Delta Chi is to promote the traditional values of Unity, Honesty, Integrity, and Leadership among women at colleges and universities. Through holding multifaceted events, KDChis learn more about themselves and their universities and communities. Then, they utilize what they have learned to become better leaders and offer optimal servitude to their surrounding areas. It's because of our members that Kappa Delta Chi is one of the strongest Latina-based sororities in the country and fosters the most powerful network among Latina leaders.

Upon graduation, members are encouraged to become part of the National Alumnae Association (NAA) and their local alumnae chapter, where they can continue serving their communities and mentoring collegiate sisters. KDChi also has a graduate/professional intake process for those who did not get the opportunity to join during their undergraduate career; to learn more about that, you can click here.
value.Summary: Northwestern Colony of Kappa Delta Chi Sorority, Inc.

value.Name: Kappa Phi Lambda Sorority, Inc.
value.Description:
Nu Chapter at Northwestern University

Established November 23, 2002

"Sisterhood, Service, and Cultural Diversity."

 

Organization Facts

National founding date: March 9, 1995

PREAMBLE
We, the sisters of Kappa Phi Lambda Sorority, Incorporated, strive to strengthen Sisterhood amongst women by providing service and promoting cultural diversity to our members and our community, thus securing the bond of kinship for posterity. Kappa Phi Lambda exists to further educate individuals about Pan-Asian culture, while keeping our own identities. We aim for academic excellence, keeping in mind the importance of education and learning as the key to strength, awareness, and fulfillment.

Colors: Scarlet Red, White, Heather Grey,

You may view the Kappa Phi Lambda National website at www.kappaphilambda.org and the chapter's website at nukpl.weebly.com.

value.Name: Kendo Club
value.Description:
Kendo Club is open to Kendoka (practitioners of Kendo) of all levels! We learn how to wield a shinai (the sword) and also learn the culture and mental practice of the sport.

We hold weekly practices that teach both basic and advanced techniques, like footwork, offensive and defensive strikes with the shinai, and etiquette.

 

Fall 2022 Quarter Practices (in SPAC):

FRIDAY 7 PM IN STUDIO 2

SUNDAY 2:30 PM IN STUDIO 1B

 

If you're interested, please join the groupme (https://groupme.com/join_group/65978985/dlTw40aU)!!
value.Summary: Kendo Club is all about Kendo, a traditional Japanese martial art known as "the way of the sword." The club is open to all and is a fun and supportive community! Come join our weekly practices!

value.Name: Kesem at Northwestern
value.Description:
Kesem at Northwestern University (also known as Camp Kesem) is a local chapter of a national organization (Kesem National) that supports children through and beyond their parent's cancer. CKNU hosts two weeks of free summer camp for over 150 children from the Chicagoland area who have been affected by a parent's cancer, in addition to other programming throughout the year.

Although our camps take place during the summer, becoming a counselor is not the only way to get involved in Kesem at Northwestern. Throughout the year, our general body members fundraise, outreach to find campers, plan events in committees, and, if applicable, get trained in order to prepare for the summer! Kesem is a great organization for any students interested in children or summer camp, or are interested in making a meaningful impact through service!

Watch this video to learn what we do here

Check out our Facebook page or Instagram to learn more!
value.Summary: Kesem is a nonprofit that organizes a free summer camp for children who have been affected by a parent's cancer.

value.Name: Keynotes
value.Description: We are a graduate student a cappella group and come from all different programs and departments on campus. We welcome all graduate students who want to sing to audition at the beginning of the year or the beginning of each quarter, please email Michelle (President) for more information. We meet once a week for 2 hours and perform at least once per quarter.
value.Summary: A graduate student a cappella group

value.Name: Knitwestern
value.Description:
Knitwestern is a learn-to-knit club for Northwestern students and community members. Knitwestern is dedicated to using knitting as a tool to build community among members of Northwestern's campus while making needed, practical winter items for donation to local organizations. Organizations we currently serve include Students Organizing for Labor Rights, Inspiration Corporation, and the Broadway Youth Center of Howard Brown Health.

 

Visit our Linktree for our social media!
value.Summary: Knitwestern is a learn-to-knit club for Northwestern students and community members. Our mission is to teach knitting and then use those talents to knit warm winter items for Inspiration Corporation and the Broadway Youth Center of Howard Brown Health.

value.Name: Korean American Student Association
value.Description:
The Korean American Students Association (KASA) is an organization formed to provide social and culturally informative activities to all those who share a common interest in the Korean culture and Korean American issues. KASA also strives to promote awareness of Korean American students’ interests as well as intercultural understanding and cooperation. KASA does not discriminate against persons of a different race, color, religion, creed, or national origin. 

Are you interested in joining our organization? Check out our Instagram @northwesternkasa or reach out to an organization officer to stay up to date!
value.Summary: The Korean American Students Association (KASA) is an organization formed to provide social and culturally informative activities to all those who share a common interest in the Korean culture and Korean American issues.

value.Name: Korean Student Association
value.Description: Korean Student Association (KSA) at Northwestern University is a voluntary organization for Korean graduate students, by Korean graduate students, and of Korean graduate students. Post-docs and visiting scholars are also members of the group. KSA supports its members through welcome events for new students, campus recruitment from Korean companies, and joint-socials with other universities in the Chicago area.
value.Summary: Korean Student Association (KSA) consists of Korean graduate students, post-docs, and visiting scholars. KSA supports its members through welcome events, campus recruitment from Korean companies, and joint-socials with other universities in Chicago.

value.Name: La Unidad Latina, Lambda Upsilon Lambda Fraternity, Inc.
value.Description: The Beta Omicron Chapter of La Unidad Latina, Lambda Upsilon Lambda Fraternity, Inc. at Northwestern University was established on April 5, 2013 with the intent of engaging members around academics, culture, brotherhood, and service. Our fraternity consists of sixty-five (65) undergraduate chapters and fourteen (14) professional chapters across sixteen (16) states and the District of Columbia. We desire engagement from men and community members committed to "our ideas of Latino unity, culture and empowerment" as stated by Founding Father Hernando Londoño.
value.Summary: The Beta Omicron Chapter of La Unidad Latina, Lambda Upsilon Lambda Fraternity, Inc. at Northwestern University was established on April 5, 2013 with the intent of engaging members around academics, culture, brotherhood, and service.

value.Name: Lambda Strategy
value.Description:
We are the first to have Kellogg MBA candidates and Northwestern undergraduates work together on consulting projects. Strategic partnerships with larger firms offer our consulting teams a pipeline of unique projects and clients. We work with high-growth, early-stage companies across various industries. Our scope, expertise, and depth of insight allow us to solve problems no other student organization can. 
 
Lambda Strategy operates at a highly professional level and maintains three initiatives: 
1. Create an environment of exceptional consultants by offering real-world experience to a group of motivated undergraduates 
2. Offer experience in project management, mentorship, and consulting to Kellogg students 
3. Offer high-impact deliverables to clients through innovation, best practices, and trustworthy relationships
value.Summary: Lambda Strategy is a strategy consulting organization run by Northwestern University undergraduates, founded in 2017.

value.Name: Lambda Theta Alpha Latin Sorority, Inc.
value.Description:
Beta Psi Chapter, Northwestern University

Established March 4, 2001

"Latin by Tradition, not by Definition."

President: Magdalena Flores 

You may visit the Beta Psi Chapter's website at http://lta-betapsi.weebly.com

Organization Facts

National Founding Date: December 1975

The purpose of Lambda Theta Alpha is to provide a sisterhood based on Unity, Love and Respect; to provide social and cultural activities, and to carry on charitable and educational programs; to promote leadership, maintain high academic standards and to serve as a voice fo rthe Latino community.

Colors: Burgundy and Gray

You may visit the Lambda Theta Alpha Inter/national website at www.lambdalady.org.

Scholarships

The Beta Psi chapter of Lambda Theta Alpha Latin Sorority, Incorporated gives out an academic scholarship, The Universal Woman Scholarship to a deserving freshman girl every year at their annual Brindis, a banquet that is held during our Founder's week to celebrate Beta Psi's presence on campus. The scholarship started in 2005. For more information on how freshmen girls can apply, email betapsi.lta@gmail.com.

Beta Psi Chapter, Northwestern University

value.Name: Latin American Student Association
value.Description: Northwestern University’s Latin American Student Association (LASA) is focused on providing a welcoming community for undergraduates by encouraging profound relations between Latin American students. LASA is a group aimed at undergraduates who feel a strong connection to Latin America, especially students who have lived an extended period of time in Latin America and are native Spanish speakers. We hope to create a community at Northwestern where our language, food and cultures are celebrated and acknowledged. LASA also hopes to provide academic and vocational guidance for Latin American students, as well as foster contacts and relationships with our Latin American Alumni through presentations, workshops and team building activities. Additionally, we seek to support and encourage prospective Latin American Students in the application process by providing information sessions, mentorship and guidance when requested or necessary.
value.Summary: Northwestern University’s Latin American Student Association (LASA) is focused on providing a welcoming community for undergraduates by encouraging profound relations between Latin American students.
