value.Description: tba
value.Summary: tba

value.Name: Leadership Development & Community Engagement
value.Description:
Dedicated to nurturing the Social Justice fighter in you through leadership development opportunities, staff advisors, cohorts, trainings and opportunities to get engaged through our Neighbor2Neighbor initiative. 

 

NU students are invited to build relationships and become actively involved with their neighbors through unique opportunities to connect with community-based organizations in Chicsgo’s Rogers Park neighborhood (just 2 miles south of campus). Some of the N2N partners include preK-8 Gale Community Academy, A Just Harvest, and Howard Area Community Center, and more. Come to a one-time program or join an on-going project. Follow us on Facebook @NUneighbor2neighbor and IG @n2n_northwestern for up coming events and shout outs!

 

Leadership development opportunities through social justice advocacy training, workshops, cohorts and online training. Ongoing programming at campus include Social Justice talks and entering your Student Organization into the Community Engagement Coalition.
value.Summary: Capacity building through creating mutually beneficial relationships with NU Students and community partners (both ongoing and one-time volunteer opportunities). Leadership development opportunities through workshops, cohorts and online training.

value.Name: Learn To Be
value.Description: The Learn To Be chapter at Northwestern University provides free, one-on-one virtual tutoring to underserved K-12 students seeking reliable academic support, primarily in the Chicagoland area. Our tutors are qualified students from Northwestern University that are committed to compassionately supporting other students within their community, both on the academic and personal level. With our partnership with Learn To Be, we strive to create lifelong learners with the assistance of technology, as well as make tutoring and mentorship accessible to all.
value.Summary: The Learn To Be chapter at Northwestern University provides free, one-on-one virtual tutoring to underserved K-12 students seeking reliable academic support, primarily in the Chicagoland area.

value.Name: Lending for Evanston and Northwestern Development
value.Description: Lending for Evanston and Northwestern Development (LEND) is dedicated to fighting poverty within Evanston by empowering and supporting the entrepreneurial aspirations of our neighbors. By offering small loans and consulting services to local entrepreneurs, LEND encourages the development of innovative businesses that enrich the Evanston community. Utilizing the unique skills of Northwestern's talented student body to support our clients through comprehensive, rigorous and systematic training, LEND seeks to create an environment in which low-income Evanston residents can obtain the business skills and capital they need to realize their entrepreneurial dreams.
value.Summary: Lending for Evanston and Northwestern Development (LEND), a 501c(3) nonprofit, seeks to empower small Evanston businesses by providing micro loans & consulting services. Since 2010, LEND has dispersed $257,000 across 56 loans.

value.Name: Liberty in North Korea
value.Description: NU LiNK is an independent chapter of the international organization Liberty in North Korea. The Rescue Team at Northwestern University was established for the purpose of changing the narrative surrounding North Korea and North Korean refugees by educating the Northwestern community and providing fundraising resources so that we may help the North Korean people achieve their freedom and develop self-efficacy during resettlement.
value.Summary: Our Liberty in North Korea Rescue Team hopes to change the narrative surrounding North Korea by educating our community and providing fundraising resources so that we may help the North Korean people achieve their freedom.

value.Name: Lipstick Theatre
value.Description: Lipstick Theatre is a student-run theatre organization at Northwestern University dedicated to intersectional feminism. We stand firmly in our commitment to create space for folks with marginalized gender identities to share their stories through performance on Northwestern’s campus. We aim to produce dramatic works that address intersectional feminist issues as well as celebrate intersecting identities with the dignity, complexity, and fullness that represent the lived experiences of people who hold those identities.
value.Summary: A student theatre group dedicated to providing creative opportunities for theatre artists of marginalized gender identities and producing intersectional feminist works.

value.Name: Lovers & Madmen
value.Description:
"Lovers and Madmen have such seething brains, such shaping fantasies, that apprehend more than cool reason ever comprehends."-William Shakespeare (A Midsummer Night's Dream)

Lovers & Madmen is a student theatre group at Northwestern University that produces a full season of classical and classically-inspired works each year. We seek to serve the NU, Evanston, and Chicago communities with our Mainstage season, as well as other smaller-scale productions, readings, and events. We are also committed to outreach, educational programming, and keeping in touch with our alumni.

Lovers & Madmen is open to all who wish to participate. We encourage anyone interested, regardless of previous experience or skill level, to get involved!

The Executive Board takes on new members through petitions which occur in Fall and Spring. We select producers and directors for our season through petitions which happen in Spring. Positions on the Executive Board or as a producer or director are unfortunately limited and these petition processes are competitive. We always see far more wonderful, qualified people than we can accept.

One can also be involved in our productions as an actor (Audition with Early Fall, Winter, and/or Spring Generals) or as a production team member (Email our friendly producers). We also are interested in working with artists who have ideas for smaller-scale projects ("Special Events"). We accept and produce these ideas on a rolling basis based on the project's artistic merit, relevance to our season and mission, and what we have the resources for.

More information about L&M and our productions can be found on our Instagram or Facebook.
value.Summary: Lovers & Madmen is a student theatre group at Northwestern University that produces a full season of classical and classically-inspired works each year.

value.Name: Lumi Tutors
value.Description: Lumi Tutors is an organization that connects select NU student tutors with underserved CPS high school students to provide a compassionate and tailored source of academic help and mentorship. Our organization provides resources for SAT test preparation to our tutors who then are responsible for creating weekly lesson plans to bring to their students. The service we provide is highly personalized to each individual student (1-1) and seeks to prepare them for higher education.
value.Summary: Lumi Tutors is an organization that connects NU student tutors with underserved CPS high school students to provide a compassionate and tailored source of academic help and mentorship. We focus on SAT tutoring and life skills workshops.

value.Name: Lutheran Campus Ministry
value.Description:
LCMNU is a welcoming community experiencing, living, and sharing the love of God through scholarship, service, and faith.  LCMNU is a student-led ministry that welcomes all of God’s people regardless of race, color, national origin, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, parental status, marital status, disability, citizenship, or veteran status. As one of  180+ campus ministries of the Evangelical Lutheran Church in America (ELCA), LCMNU shares in the mission “to invite people in academic settings to engage more deeply with the teachings of Jesus Christ and the community that bears his name, so that they can discover and fulfill their vocation as disciples.”

We invite you to go to https://www.lcmnorthwestern.org/ to learn more about us, and we especially invite you to join us. During the fall 2023 quarter, we will worship at 11am every Sunday and gather every Wednesday at 6-6:45pm for Supper Worship. Welcome to LCMNU!
value.Summary: Lutheran Campus Ministry is a welcoming community experiencing, living, and sharing the love of God through scholarship, service, and faith.

value.Name: Mahjong Club
value.Description:
(It's 2023 and WE ARE BACK AND RUNNING!)

    Northwestern University Mahjong Club is a student-run organization dedicated to promoting the game of mahjong among the university community.

    The club is open to all students, regardless of experience level, and provides an inclusive and welcoming environment for members to learn and play mahjong. With a focus on both casual and competitive play, the club hosts regular meetings, tournaments, and events throughout the academic year.

    Members of the Northwestern University Mahjong Club have the opportunity to improve their strategy and game skills, socialize with other mahjong enthusiasts, and participate in a vibrant community of players on campus.
value.Summary: The Northwestern University Mahjong Club provides a welcoming and inclusive environment for students of all skill levels to learn and play mahjong while fostering a community and promoting the benefits of the game.

value.Name: makenew
value.Description: [make]new aims to create a support network of Northwestern students from diverse backgrounds that can provide emotional and relational support for one another. College is a time of growth and change in which everyone experiences ups and downs; having a network of close personal relationships is crucial for the difficult patches. We hope to forge a community where lifelong friendships are formed. It is vitally important that we encourage honest conversations between students of all faith backgrounds, and many of our meetings will be focused on fostering open dialogue about God and Christianity, as well as other worldviews, faith, and values. Finally, we seek to create a space for Christian students to experience real growth in their faith as they interact with one another through day to day student life.
value.Summary: [make]new is a Christian fellowship where students of all backgrounds can experience close community and learn more about the Christian faith.

value.Name: Mariachi Northwestern
value.Description: Mariachi Northwestern is a student group that strives to expose our surrounding communities to Mariachi music and culture! We have performed at events ranging from campus activities to hired gigs all over the Chicagoland area. Any singer, violinist, guitarist, bass, accordionist, or trumpet player is welcome to join us, no Mariachi background or Spanish language prerequisite necessary.
value.Summary: Northwestern's first and premier Mariachi group! Celebrating the culture and tradition of Mariachi music at NU. All NU students are welcome to join!

value.Name: Masculinity, Allyship, Reflection, Solidarity
value.Description: We are an all-masculine-identifying organization dedicated to ending rape culture and "restrictive masculinity" on campus through self-work & peer-led discussions. MARS is a space to be vulnerable, genuinely learn about yourself, build connections with others, and be an ally for those impacted by various forms of violence on campus. You will learn skills in teaching, leading discussions, and developing activities aimed at exploring how re-imagining rigid societal expectations of masculinity can help lessen acts of violence as well as improve overall well-being.
value.Summary: We are an all-masculine-identifying organization dedicated to ending rape culture & restrictive masculinity on campus through self-work & peer-led discussions. MARS is a space to be vulnerable, genuine, build connections & learn to support others.

value.Name: Master Clash
value.Summary: N/A

value.Summary: N/A

value.Name: Master of Science, Data Science (MSDS) Student Leadership Council
value.Description: The Master of Science in Data Science (MSDS) at Northwestern University is one of the fastest growing and most established Data Science programs in the United States. The purpose of MSDS Student Leadership Council (SLC) is to help foster relationships among students in the program, alumni, and world-renowned industry professionals. The MSDS SLCcreates opportunities and events that allow students and alumni of the program to grow their knowledge of Data Science and their professional networks.
value.Summary: The purpose of MSDS Student Leadership Council (SLC) is to help foster relationships a

value.Name: Masters in Engineering Management Student Advisory Board
value.Description: The Student Advisory Board for MEM is a group of MEM students that represent the student body. SAB hopes to foster community within MEM by hosting social events, increase relationships between MEM with other graduate programs, and to market the MEM brand. The greater goal is to increase the value of the MEM degree.
value.Summary: The Student Advisory Board for MEM is a group of MEM students that represent the student body.  SAB hopes to foster community within MEM by hosting social events, increase relationships between MEM with other graduate programs.

value.Name: Materials Science Club
value.Summary: N/A

value.Name: Matriculate
value.Description:
Matriculate leverages peer-to-peer relationships and networks to empower high-achieving, low-moderate-income high school students to enroll in their best-fit college or university. We train talented college students at high graduation rate institutions across the U.S. to provide the information, guidance, and support these high school students need to apply to, gain admission to, and excel in higher education.

Being a Matriculate Advising Fellow means making a commitment to guide and support high-achieving, low-income high school students across the country as they navigate the college admissions process. We’re looking for undergraduates who are passionate about helping others navigate the college process, have strong interpersonal skills, and above all, who want to make a difference in someone’s life.
value.Summary: Matriculate’s mission is to support high-achieving, low-to-moderate-income high school students to make the leap to college. Our vision is that one day all students in the U.S. will have access to higher education regardless of socioeconomic status.

value.Name: MaxForum
value.Description: MaxForum is a student-run affiliation group created for the exchange of knowledge related to electronic music. Though we meet in the Bienen School of Music, our group welcomes students from across Northwestern with any musical or technological background. Our main focus is fostering an electronic music community by sharing ideas, tools, patches, and practices, and organizing community member-led teaching sessions. MaxForum will be made up of core and peripheral members. Core members, who agree to attend regularly throughout the quarter, are offered weeks throughout the quarter in which they can facilitate group discussion and learning sessions. Peripheral members are welcome to come as often as they choose, and may participate fully in any facilitated session. The main software of the club will be MaxMSP from Cycle ‘74, but over the course of this club other softwares like; Pure Data (PD), Csound, Ableton Live, Adobe Audition, will also become part.
value.Summary: MaxForum is a student-run affiliation group created for the exchange of knowledge related to electronic music. Though we meet in Bienen School of Music, our group welcomes students from across Northwestern with any musical or technological background.

value.Name: Mayfest Productions
value.Description: Mayfest Productions is responsible for producing Dillo Day, the nation’s largest student-run music festival. Beyond Dillo, Mayfest hosts a series of special events throughout spring quarter including Battle of the Bands and Battle of the DJs which highlights student artists — the winners of our battle events earn a slot to perform on the Main Stage at Dillo Day. Along with our student artists, we also book A-list artists for our Main Stage and we collaborate with FMO, Northwestern's black student alliance, to book artists for our second stage - and it's all free to Northwestern students! That being said, Mayfest works year-round to ensure that Dillo Day is safe, fun, and inclusive for Northwesterners, their guests, and the greater Evanston community.Past artists include Daniel Caesar, Hippo Campus, A$AP Ferg, Rico Nasty, Regina Spektor, Kendrick Lamar, Steve Aoki, Chance the Rapper, 2chainz, The Mowgli's, Anderson .Pakk, and ScHoolboy Q. This year's lineup coming soon!
value.Summary:
www.dilloday.com

Mayfest produces Dillo Day, as well as a series of special events throughout spring quarter. We book A-list artists for the largest student-run music festival in the country - and it's all free to Northwestern students.

value.Name: McCormick Graduate Leadership Council
value.Description:
The McCormick Graduate Leadership Council (MGLC) has three main goals:

  1. Build a graduate student community among the eight departments within the McCormick School.
  2. Organize social, academic, and professional activities
  3. Facilitate communication between McCormick graduate students and the McCormick Dean's office
value.Summary: The McCormick Graduate Leadership Council helps graduate students connect through networking, professional development and social events.

value.Name: McCormick Student Advisory Board
value.Summary: McCormick advisory board for undergraduate students.

value.Name: Medical Makers
value.Description: The purpose of Medical Makers is to innovate, design, and build medical devices that serve unmet clinical needs. Medical Makers aims to help members learn the prototyping process and acquire technical skills in medical device design.
value.Summary: tba

value.Name: Medill Undergraduate Student Advisory Council
value.Description: MUSAC works to improve the student experience at Medill by listening to student feedback, organizing events and providing feedback on a number of initiatives. The council’s biggest event each year is the Student Showcase, where the best student work is displayed in the MTC Forum and Lobby for students, faculty and staff to enjoy.
value.Summary: The Medill Undergraduate Student Advisory Council is a selection of freshmen, sophomore, junior and senior Medill students that represents the undergraduate community to members of Medill's administration on work with them collaboratively.

value.Name: Mee-Ow Improv and Sketch Comedy
value.Description:
Founded in 1974, Mee-Ow Comedy is Northwestern University's premiere short-form comedy group combining sketch comedy, improv, and live music.  Mee-Ow has an impressive list of alumni, including Seth Meyers and Julia Louis-Dreyfus.  

Come audition for us, work with us, and check out our shows!  We can't wait to make something funny with you!
value.Summary: Founded in 1974, Mee-Ow is Northwestern University's premiere short-form comedy group combining sketch, improv and rock n' roll.

value.Name: Men's Basketball
value.Description:
The Northwestern Club Basketball Team has been competing against regional junior college and club teams for over 20 years. We serve as an outlet for the competitive desires of talented NU students, as well as a platform for exceptionally gifted players to make the next step up to the varsity team.

We are a proud member of the NCBBA league and compete in several games and tournaments throughout the school year. We also organize non-conference games with various schools within driving distance of NU. Anyone interested in playing is welcome to attend our tryout generally held the first week of October. 

If you have any questions or would like to learn more about the team, please feel free to contact us at zackrosenstadt2024@u.northwestern.edu
value.Summary: The Northwestern Club Basketball Team has been competing against regional junior college and club teams for over 20 years. We serve as an outlet for the competitive desires of talented NU students and as a platform for exceptionally gifted players

value.Name: Men's Club Lacrosse
value.Description:
MEN’S CLUB LACROSSE

The Men’s Club Lacrosse team is part of the Great Lakes Lacrosse League (GLLL). We play competitively against teams in and around the Chicago-land area. The fall season begins in September and runs to the end of October. The spring season begins in late March and extends to early May.

Games

We typically play anywhere between 4-6 games in the fall against teams in the Chicago-land area. The bulk of our schedule is in the spring which includes approximately 10-12 games during the regular season and a year-end bracket style tournament to determine the GLLL champions. We play all other teams in the “Chicago Division” of the GLLL: Northern Illinois, Western Illinois, University of Chicago, Lake Forest College, and Loyola University. We also play teams in the Central (e.g. University of Wisconsin – Madison) and Eastern (e.g. Notre Dame, School Craft) division during the regular season. We will occasionally travel on away games for regular season competition and the year-end tournament which is hosted on a rotating basis.

Practices

In the fall, we are scheduled to practice three times a week, as well as opportunities for group fitness. We stress the importance of coming to practice, so please try to arrange your class schedule around practice times. Practice times will be in the evenings usually from either 7-9pm or 8-10pm.

In the winter, we reserve a two hour block in the University’s indoor turf facility. The format for this time block is more flexible that in the fall and spring. At times, we practice. Other times we devote the time to the development of specific skills and non-contact drills.

In the spring, we are scheduled to practice two times a week, reserving the third and possibly fourth day of activity for competition. Attending practices in the spring is integral to success during competition. We encourage 100% participation in practice and other events in the spring. Practice times will be in the evenings usually from either 7-9pm or 8-10pm.

*Please note that the practice schedule may change according to our allocated field space and time each season.

Dues

All members are required to pay club dues, which are approximately $225. This is necessary to cover the league fees, referee fees, travel costs, apparel, and social events. The apparel provided by the Club for its members is: 1 reversible jersey, 1 pairs of shorts, and additional apparel will be made available trough the team shop (1 tee, 1 sweatshirt, and 1 pair of sweatpants). Members have an opportunity to order protective equipment (e.g. helmet, gloves) through the club at a discounted rate.

Tryouts

Practice will begin at the end of New Student week. We encourage players with any previous playing experience to join and truly welcome all to join. A percentage of the membership has not played lacrosse before arriving to Northwestern campus. In addition to playing lacrosse, the team arranges outings and gatherings in order to build a strong community for the players.

If you have any questions about the Men’s Lacrosse Club, please contact us at Liamomalley2024@u.northwestern.edu
value.Summary: The NU Men's Lacrosse Club welcomes all undergrads/grad students to join. Membership includes players with a wide range of skill from beginner to former NCAA athletes. We aim to have fun during practices and compete in the Great Lakes Lacrosse League.

value.Name: Men's Club Soccer
value.Description:
The NU Men's Club Soccer team is comprised of student athletes looking to continue playing competitive soccer without the restrictions and demands of a Varsity program during their undergraduate and graduate experiences. Our roster is brimming with talent, including former Varsity athletes and high school standouts, and we are exceptionally proud of the club's professionalism and level of play. In the past, our club finished twice in the Top 10 in the nation, we are extremely excited to continue to build on the club's recent successes.

Our fall season consists of 8 regular season games against other teams in the Metro division of the Midwest conference. Pending qualification, the Midwest regional tournament takes place in late October, and the national tournament takes place in mid-November. With practices two times a week and games on the weekend, the season is fast-paced and demands a sizable commitment, but does not conflict with class time.

The informal winter and spring seasons consist of occasional friendlies and two practices a week at the University's state-of-the-art indoor sports facility, Ryan Fieldhouse, as well as Martin Stadium.

THIS YEAR, TRYOUTS WILL BE SATURDAY, SEPTEMBER 18TH FROM 9 AM - NOON AND SUNDAY, SEPTEMBER 19th FROM 10 AM - NOON. THEY WILL BE LOCATED ON LONG FIELD, WHICH IS DIRECTLY NORTH OF ELDER. PLEASE SHOW UP ABOUT 30 MINUTES EARLY TO WARM UP AND BRING BOTH A LIGHT AND DARK SHIRT. Additional tryouts will occur depending on if a player is asked to return the following day. The roster tends to come in at around twenty-five to thirty athletes, and club members will be expected to pay a specified amount in team dues at the beginning of the season.

We practice and play our home matches at the fantastic Lakeside Field on the shore of Lake Michigan, and travel within the region to all of our away matches.

Although we are committed to success on the pitch, the very fabric of NU Men's Club Soccer is our commitment to camaraderie. Playing for the club is an awesome opportunity to continue to play competitive soccer, and provides a close-knit community for incoming students at the beginning of the academic year.
value.Summary: The NU Men's Club Soccer team is comprised of student athletes looking to continue playing competitive soccer without the restrictions and demands of a Varsity program during their undergraduate and graduate experiences.

value.Name: Men's Ice Hockey
value.Description: We are Northwestern's Men's Club Hockey Team. We practice twice a week on Monday and Wednesday. We usually play 2 games a weekend, 3 weekends a month during fall and winter quarter; we travel to about half of our games. We are affiliated with the ACHA. To see more please visit http://northwesternhockey.org/
value.Summary: We're NU's Club Hockey Team. We hold practices on Monday and Wednesday at the brand new Robert Crown Center. We typically have 2 games/weekend, during fall and winter quarter with surrounding teams. ACHA DIII. Please visit http://northwesternhockey.org

value.Name: Men's Rugby Football Club
value.Description:
Originally founded in the spring of 1972, the Northwestern University Men's Rugby club is a competitive Collegiate Division II rugby club in the National Collegiate Rugby organization.

Northwestern Men's Rugby's main season is during the fall, where it competes against teams such as Western Illinois, Eastern Illinois, Illinois State, Loyola, University of Chicago, etc. The squad, consisting of players with high levels of prior experience in rugby to players who have never heard of rugby, welcomes all players to join if they are interested in pursuing an active and new sport at the collegiate level.

Northwestern Rugby also competes during the spring, playing several Chicago area rivals as well as out-of-league squads. Northwestern Rugby are the 2007 CARFU Champions, the 2008 CARFU Runner-ups, and the 2009 CARFU Champions. More recently, NURFC finished the fall 2016 season as CARFU Champions and WISCARFU Championship Finalists. Additionally, Northwestern won the Chicago Cup in 2017. The team also competes every year in the Big Ten Sevens Tournament.

If interested, please contact Ben Bade (President) at benjaminbade2023@u.northwestern.edu, or at the official NU Men's Rugby email address, nu.mensrugby@gmail.com. Feel free to visit our official Facebook page seen below for up-to-date practice and team information.
value.Summary: Originally founded in the spring of 1972, the Northwestern University Men's Rugby club is a member of the NCR organization. Follow us on Facebook and Instagram for event information.

value.Name: Men's Ultimate Frisbee
value.Description:
Northwestern Ultimate Team.

We are a team of friends and brothers that work hard and play hard together. We practice 2-3 times a week and attend 6-8 tournaments over the calendar year, competing in USA Ultimate's Division 1 College Series. All are welcome at our practices regardless of skill level or prior experience!

Some words from Chucktown (NUT ’03, Coach ’12-’13):

  • Learn how to play the right way and how to be the man you want to be in the world. The winning, the fulfillment of your hopes and dreams: it all comes in time. We can’t control when or where it comes. We can control how we show up and how much we choose to believe in the process. We CAN buy in.

Email captains@nutultimate.com or check nutultimate.com for updates from the top. If you're interested in playing with us in 2022-23, please fill out this interest form. 

2022 Incoming Player Form

Best,

Captains
value.Summary: Northwestern Men's Club Ultimate team.

value.Name: Men's Volleyball
value.Description:
Do you have high school varsity or club volleyball experience and want to continue playing at a high level in college? Northwestern Men's Club Volleyball is an opportunity for students to do just that. We practice twice a week and compete ins several matches and tournaments per quarter. We are a member of MIVA (Midwest Intercollegiate Volleyball Association) and annually compete against Big 10 teams at various tournaments throughout the Midwest.

---

Join our men's volleyball team if you’re looking for thrilling competition and great brotherhood!
value.Summary: NU Men's Volleyball is an opportunity for players who played competitive volleyball in high school at the club/varsity level to continue playing on a high-level team with multiple matches and tournaments each quarter.

value.Name: Menstrual Equity Activists
value.Description:
Our three pillars:

1. Service: Provide free, safe, and accessible menstrual products to Evanston service partners (homeless shelters, free clinics, food pantries, LGBTQI+ resource centers, domestic violence shelters, schools, and other non-profits) to fulfill the needs of our community

2. Education: Educate our local community on menstrual health and equity to destigmatize menstruation

3. Policy: Advocate for systemic change through policy and legislation. Reach out to state representatives, canvass, and lobby

 

During the school year, our members work to implement a variety of community initiatives within Northwestern and beyond:

1. Sustainability: Raise awareness about sustainable menstrual products, such as menstrual cups and period underwear, and distribute them to college students and community partners.

2. Menstrual Products in Dorms: Advocate for the implementation of free menstrual products in dorms by organizing petitions, meeting with campus administrators, and creating student advocacy initiatives.

3. International Outreach: Fundraise for menstrual education projects around the world that distribute reusable, environmentally sustainable sanitary kits.
value.Summary: We are a menstrual equity activism group that works to alleviate period poverty and period stigma through service, education, and policy reform in Evanston, the state of Illinois, and around the world.

value.Name: MENtal Health
value.Summary: MENtal Health combats stigma around mental health to the male population of NU. MENtal Health responds to gender discrepancies in use of mental health resources at NU. We aim to combat negative perceptions of masculinity that can lead to health issues.

value.Name: Mental Health Mix & Mingle
value.Description: Mental Health Mix and Mingle (MHMM) is a group for graduate students in the two programs housed within The Family Institute at Northwestern University (Counseling and Marriage & Family Therapy). The group is designed to bring together the students from both programs in social, professional, and educational events to foster connections and relationships among peers.
value.Summary: Mental Health Mix and Mingle is a graduate student-based group that aims to connect the two graduate programs housed within The Family Institute (Counseling and Marriage & Family Therapy).

value.Name: Mentorship Opportunities for Research and Engagement
value.Description: MORE is a student organization that provides opportunities for Northwestern graduate students and postdocs to mentor and empower high school students interested in STEM. This mentorship takes a variety of forms, including one-on-one mentoring for independent research projects, group discussion panels on STEM careers and research, and MORE! We would love to have you on board with us to participate in outreach activities and help inspire the next generation of STEM students!
value.Summary: MORE is a student organization that provides opportunities for Northwestern graduate students and postdocs to mentor and empower high school students interested in STEM.

value.Name: Middle Eastern North African Student Association
value.Description:
We celebrate the unique cultural identities of the MENA region through events centering cultural music, dance, and food. 

In the past we have hosted many events such as: Bonfires, mixers, Shai (tea) nights, cooking cultural dishes nights (koshari and warak enab), dabke (traditional Levantine dance) workshops, Arab Heritage month programming such as Arab Expressions, Assyrian New Years event, Valentine’s day kickback, game night, karaoke night,  and MENA Formal where we rented out a venue and brought a professional belly dancer, dabke group, and had a traditional MENA zaffe. 

We also advocate for the visibility of MENA students on campus, by demanding more representation on campus and advocating for human rights regarding issues in the MENA region. 

Please follow our Instagram @Mena.Northwestern to stay up to date with events, feel free to contact us through DM! Also please fill out our listserv form in order to receive bi-weekly email updates!
value.Summary: Our organization is a community that serves as a home away from home for Middle Eastern North African (MENA) students on campus and allows for MENA students to represent and share their heritage with the greater NU community.

value.Name: MiniChefz
value.Description: MiniChefz is a non-profit organization comprised of college students. We have worked together to develop a curriculum based around nutrition, healthy eating, and a healthy lifestyle. Our volunteers dedicate themselves to improving their cooking skills and learning the curriculum in order to travel into neighboring communities and work with the youth population in order to help encourage healthier life choices. Nutrition is a key component to a healthy life. Our goal is to create healthy eating habits for youth in order to prevent many of the health issues that arise in adulthood.
value.Summary: MiniChefz is an organization that looks to encourage healthy eating and nutrition among the youth of our city.

value.Name: Minority Association of Pre-Med Students at Northwestern
value.Description: The purpose of MAPS is to serve the minority pre-health students of Northwestern University, by providing valuable information that pre-health students need, prior to attending medical or graduate school, through meetings, workshops, events, etc. This organization works diligently to try to stimulate the interests, of pre-health students at Northwestern University by encouraging and promoting all minorities in medicine and other health professions. As the representative voice of Northwestern’s minority pre-health students, MAPS seeks to instill a consciousness in its members about contemporary issues and disparities of the medical world, especially those that pertain to minority groups. MAPS aims to prepare its members for the rigors of their health and science careers in an efficient manner.
value.Summary: The purpose of MAPS is to serve the minority pre-health students of Northwestern  by providing valuable information that pre-health students need, prior to attending medical or graduate school, through meetings, workshops, events, etc.

value.Name: MIXED Student Association
value.Description: Multiracial Identity Xperience Education and Dialogue (MIXED) Student Association, was founded in 2013 as the Mixed Student Coalition and renamed MIXED Student Association in 2020. MIXED was founded to provide a space for those who identify with a multiracial background or have interest in mixed race affairs. MIXED serves to create an inclusive community for people of all racial/ethnic backgrounds by hosting fun activities as well as generating discussions and bringing in speakers with an emphasis on the multiracial experience.
value.Summary: MIXED serves to create an inclusive community for people of all racial/ethnic backgrounds by hosting fun activities as well as generating discussions and bringing in speakers with an emphasis on the multiracial experience.

value.Name: Mock Trial
value.Description: Northwestern Mock Trial (NUMT), a top 10 finishing team at Nationals the past three years, competes against the top programs across the nation in simulated trial tournaments where participants are scored for their advocacy skills as lawyers and performance as witnesses. The program offers team members the opportunity to improve their public speaking abilities, analytical skills, trial advocacy techniques and acting capabilities while experiencing the drama of a courtroom. Mock Trial is perfect for those who are competitive, enjoy public speaking or love to act. We take new members from all experience levels (more than half of our members joined with no mock trial experience!) and majors, whether you're interested in the law or just love performing in front of others. No matter your interests, there's a spot for you on NUMT!
value.Summary: NUMT competes against the top programs across the nation in simulated trial tournaments where participants are scored for their advocacy skills as lawyers and performance as witnesses.

value.Name: Morning Mentors
value.Summary: Morning Mentors aims to develop the graduate community by providing an opportunity for community service and bringing together students of different departments with similar goals and interests by facilitating a tutoring program for a local school.

value.Name: Mortar Board
value.Description: Mortar Board is the premier national honor society for students of senior standing that recognizes superior achievement in scholarship, leadership, and service.
value.Summary: Mortar Board is the premier national honor society for students of senior standing that recognizes superior achievement in scholarship, leadership, and service.

value.Name: Multicultural Filmmakers Collective
value.Description: The purpose of the Multicultural Filmmakers Collective is to nurture, promote, and ally multicultural student filmmakers at Northwestern University, as well as support student films that present multicultural concerns and experiences. We define multicultural as including, but not limited to, underrepresented races, ethnicities, and religions. In addition to general meetings, our programming includes film screenings, script workshops, and speaker events.
value.Summary: The purpose of the Multicultural Filmmakers Collective is to nurture, promote, and ally multicultural student filmmakers at Northwestern University, as well as support student films that present multicultural concerns and experiences.

value.Name: Multicultural Greek Council
value.Description: The MGC is a unique community of fraternities and sororities; each of these member organizations’ foundations is founded upon celebrating cultural diversity and educating the community about its rich cultural heritage.  The MGC and the Greek-letter organizations are powerful media through which group members can express and share their cultural pride.  The members cherish the belief that the college experience is more valuable when it includes self-expression through the richness of diversity.
value.Summary: The MGC is a unique community of fraternities and sororities; each of these member organizations' foundations is founded upon celebrating cultural diversity and educating the community about its rich cultural heritage.

value.Name: Multicultural Student Affairs
value.Description: Multicultural Student Affairs is committed to fostering an inclusive environment that promotes identity development, intercultural exchange, academic excellence, and leadership. While our departments primarily focus on traditionally under-served student populations, we strive to play an important role in creating an institutional climate that values diversity and educates the Northwestern community about cultural competence and social justice.
value.Summary: Multicultural Student Affairs is committed to fostering an inclusive environment that promotes identity development, intercultural exchange, academic excellence, and leadership. While our departments primarily focus on traditionally under-served student

value.Name: Muslim-cultural Students Association
value.Description: The Muslim-cultural Students Association (McSA) is a community oriented organization that caters to the many different needs of Northwestern students. Our members are Muslim and non-Muslim alike. Even with such a diverse membership, our fundamental goals remain the same. Be it Discover Islam Week, philanthropy food drives, Ramadan dinners, or simply tutoring younger students, our primary motive is to promote the human values that Islam emphasizes: community, equality, justice, mercy, compassion and peace. In addition, by supporting other organizations or events, we hope to foster unity not only in McSA, but also among other NU student organizations, faculty and administrators.
value.Summary: The Muslim-cultural Students Association (McSA) is a community oriented organization that caters to the many different needs of Muslim Northwestern students. Our motive is to promote the values that Islam emphasizes: community, equality, & justice.

value.Name: National Alzheimer's Buddies
value.Description: As a Northwestern chapter of the National Alzheimer’s Buddies organization, our purpose is to build meaningful connections between students and cognitively impaired individuals affected by Alzheimer’s Disease. NAB is an intergenerational movement responding to the profound isolation and social disengagement experienced by people in the intermediate-to-late stages of Alzheimer’s Disease who are living in long-term care facilities.
value.Summary: The NU chapter of National Alzheimer’s Buddies aims to facilitate the formation of meaningful relationships between college students and cognitively impaired individuals, affected by Alzheimer's disease, who are residing in long-term care facilities.

value.Name: National Association of Black Journalists
value.Description:
The National Association of Black Journalists serves as a resource and outlet for graduate and undergraduate students interested in pursuing a career in mass communications and journalism.
As an auspice, the Northwestern chapter seeks to uphold an organic atmosphere and community in which all of our members can grow professionally and personally. NABJ-NU also creates opportunities for students to develop meaningful relationships, harness impressive skills and build confidence in their careers.
NABJ welcomes students who are majoring in journalism and also those who are not.
value.Summary: The NU chapter of the National Association of Black Journalists is a student organization that provides resources, professional development opportunities, and a community space for black students seeking careers in journalism or media.

value.Name: National Eating Disorders Association (NEDA) Campus Warriors
value.Description: Campus Warriors are individual students, faculty members, and student organizations with direct or indirect lived experience with eating disorders representing NEDA on their college and university campuses. Campus Warriors aim to educate their school community about the warning signs, symptoms, and impact caused by eating disorders by participating in awareness events on campus. They strive to create an inclusive and supportive environment on college campuses where people no longer need to feel alone. In addition to raising awareness, Campus Warriors are committed to fundraising for NEDA’s programs and services.
value.Summary: Campus Warriors is an outreach initiative designed to engage colleges and universities across the United States to raise awareness about eating disorders and fundraise for NEDA.

value.Name: National Pan-Hellenic Council
value.Description:
The National Pan-Hellenic Council (NPHC) at Northwestern University consists of seven of the "Divine Nine" historically black fraternities and sororities. Each of the NPHC organizations evolved during a period when African Americans were denied essential rights and privileges afforded to other college students. NPHC organizations maintain high positive standards for its member organizations and ensure the perpetuation of responsibility and privilege through engaging in service to the African American community at NU and the community at large.

 

The 2021-2022 Council of Presidents & Officers:

Council of Presidents

Marc Montgomery - Alpha Mu (Vice Chair)

Eden Strong - Eta

Samad Acklin - Theta (Chair)

Kamaryn Johnson - Theta Alpha

Officers

Director of Finance - Mychael Torres

Director of PR & Marketing - Jessica Hunter

Director of Justice Initiatives - Sam Anderson
value.Summary: The National Pan-Hellenic Council, Inc. (NPHC) at Northwestern University consists of seven of the "Divine Nine" historically black fraternities and sororities.

value.Name: National Residence Hall Honorary
value.Description: NRHH strives to provide recognition for individuals who have contributed to the advancement of college and university housing. It ensures the advancement of member chapters through resource sharing, programming, and leadership development opportunities.
value.Summary: Northwestern University's chapter of the National Residence Hall Honorary

value.Name: National Society of Black Engineers - Northwestern Chapter
value.Description: The National Society of Black Engineers (NSBE)'s mission is to increase the number of culturally responsible black engineers who excel academically, succeed professionally, and positively impact the community. We host professional development workshops, company sponsored networking events, and community building activities. You do not have to be a member to attend any of our events, so come out and see what NU NSBE is all about!
value.Summary: The National Society of Black Engineers (NSBE)'s mission is to increase the number of culturally responsible black engineers who excel academically, succeed professionally, and positively impact the community.

value.Name: National Student Speech-Language-Hearing Association-NU
value.Description: The NU NSSLHA Chapter is a pre-professional association for graduate and undergraduate students interested in the study of communication sciences and disorders (CSD).  We are one of over 300 university chapters representing the greater national organization of NSSLHA, which is the only student organization recognized by the American Speech-Language-Hearing Association (ASHA), the national professional, scientific, and credentialing association for the communication sciences and disorders.
value.Summary: The NU NSSLHA Chapter is a pre-professional association for graduate and undergraduate students interested in the study of communication sciences and disorders (CSD).

value.Name: NAWTE
value.Description: n/a
value.Summary: tba

value.Name: Neuro Club
value.Description:
The Northwestern University Neuro Club brings together a diverse set of students interested in any of the numerous fields of Neuroscience. We hope this club will not only inform the Northwestern community of the many facets of Neuroscience but also centralize the resources of both of the Northwestern Campuses to give a well-organized structure for education in Neuroscience. We hope to accomplish these things through events, community-service projects, and other ways.

The Community Service Committee works with local Evanston and Chicago schools, nursery homes, and organizations to plan community service events at least once per quarter. 

The Speaker Committee brings in (at least one) speaker from the field of Neuroscience per quarter.

The Public Relations Committee publicizes club events and helps recruit committed members who are willing to contribute to the organization.
value.Summary: The Northwestern University Neuro Club is a student-run organization with the goal of furthering the education and understanding of neuroscience and related fields within and surrounding the Northwestern University community.

value.Name: New Life Volunteering Society
value.Description:
New Life Volunteering Society is a non-profit volunteering organization for students from medical schools at CMS, UChicago, Northwestern, Loyola, and UIC and undergraduates from Northwestern, Loyola, and UIC. The NLVS organization has a clinic in Little India in the Devon neighborhood where medical and undergraduate students can volunteer. At Northwestern, we are a health-oriented volunteering club that helps serve the Chicago and local Evanston communities. Some of our initiatives include designing and presenting health series at homeless centers, tutoring, and volunteering at local community centers, retirement homes, and health clinics, such as the NLVS clinic.

NLVS members are also connected with the NLVS chapter at Northwestern's Feinberg School of Medicine and we sometimes hold events with them. Please contact us with any questions!
value.Summary: New Life Volunteering Society (NLVS) provides health-related service and leadership opportunities for Northwestern students.  We have ties to health clinics in the Chicago area, the Feinberg School of Medicine, and Evanston-based organizations.

value.Name: New Movement Project
value.Description:
The objectives of New Movement Project (NMP) is to offer students support, resources, and programming with the goal to facilitate artistic discoveries and participation in the endeavors of other members, including those that reach beyond the university community.  NMP’s programming initiatives include producing the Fall Dance Concert, hosting guest artists for residencies & workshops -- including David Parker & The Bang Group (2009); Emily Johnson (2010); Cyrus Khambatta (2011) -- and sponsoring individuals’ own projects as they make discoveries through movement.

New Movement Project enriches and enhances the dance experience of all actively motivated members of the Northwestern dance community. New Movement Project utilizes its resources as well as departmental, university, and community partnerships to provide students with elements of the dance experience not regularly provided by the curriculum.
value.Summary: NMP's mission is to provide students with the resources and programming to support their artistic discoveries through dance by producing the yearly Fall Dance Concert, hosting guest artists for residencies and workshops, and supporting projects.

value.Name: New Student Organization Review Committee
value.Summary: This group meets quarterly to deliberate on proposals for new registered student organizations to be recognized.

value.Name: Niteskool
value.Description: Niteskool is the premier music management and video production group dedicated to finding and promoting the most talented musicians at Northwestern. We aim to bring these artists into the spotlight on campus and catapult them to success in the broader music industry. Niteskool Productions focuses on producing high-quality music videos to connect Northwestern students to their talented peers and provide otherwise unavailable opportunities to student musicians. Meanwhile, Niteskool Records focuses on manging student artists, with dedicated A&R members, a community marketing team, and giving artists opportunities to create their own videos, or create recorded performances at school events. Together, under the Niteskool banner, we serve to empower student artists and create a community where anyone can gain firsthand experience in the music industry!
value.Summary: Niteskool is the premier music management/'record label' and video production group on campus. Whether through highly professional student-produced music content, or our dedicated teams for Marketing and A&R, Niteskool aims to engage with all NU artists.

value.Name: No Fun Mud Piranhas
value.Description: n/a
value.Summary: An audition-free improv group providing a space for students to practice their skills, learn new techniques, and enjoy the art of improv in a supportive environment. Weekly meetings and quarterly shows.

value.Name: Norris Box Office
value.Description: The Norris Box Office serves as a ticketing agent for student organizations holding accounts with the Student Organization Finance Office or a University department.  Services include ticket printing and sales (on-site and on-line), individual stamp and envelope sales (cash only), and domestic fax send/receive.
value.Summary: Northwestern University department within Student Affairs serving as primary ticket printing and sales agent for registered Northwestern University student organizations and departments. Located on the first floor of Norris University Center.

value.Name: Norris Cashier's Office
value.Description: The Cashier's Office works in conjunction with the Student Organization Finance Office to maintain a student organization banking structure that faciliates transaction-based requests.  It offers starting funds, depository and coin counting services, as well as notary services.
value.Summary: An office within the Cash Operations Area that offers deposit and starting fund services for student organizations.

value.Name: Norris Operations Staff
value.Description: Room set-ups, information desk, and Center Managers of the Norris University Center.
value.Summary: Norris Operations Staff student employee site.

value.Name: Norris University Center
value.Summary: Home to an array of services, resources, and meeting spaces, Norris University Center is the center of campus life at Northwestern community.

value.Name: North by Northwestern
value.Description:
North by Northwestern is one of Northwestern University’s leading online and print publications, updated around the clock with stories about campus and culture. Our website launched over the summer of 2006, and in spring 2008, we launched a print magazine. Both online and off, we report the truth, tell stories and have fun. This is a site where we can talk about what’s actually on our minds, share our passions and have a conversation with our readers.

We’ve been honored with 36 Mark of Excellence awards from the Society of Professional Journalists and won the 2008 National Online Pacemaker Awards.

North by Northwestern is proud to be a member of the Campus Progress journalism network.

Let us know if you want to get involved. We’re always looking for new writers, editors, photographers, videographers, multimedia producers, designers, social media managers, marketers and businesspeople.
value.Summary: North by Northwestern is one of Northwestern University's best independent online publications, updated around the clock with stories about campus and culture. In Spring 2008, we launched a print magazine.

value.Name: Northwestern A Cappella Community Alliance
value.Description: NACCA serves to provide organizational representation for all a cappella groups on Northwestern's campus. NACCA administrates auditions, preferences, and conferrals for all potential new members of the Northwestern A Cappella Community. They also plan and facilitate A Cappella Fest during Wildcat Welcome Week.
value.Summary: The governing body of Northwestern's 14 a cappella groups.

value.Name: Northwestern Anime Club
value.Description:
Welcome to NU Anime Club! Our group brings together students at Northwestern University for gatherings and events focused on all things Japan: anime, manga, video games and much more.

Check us out on Facebook and feel free to email us with questions! NU Anime Club FB 

Our group prides itself on having diverse interests and offering activities to promote them. Although each week you will find us meeting to watch the latest shows from Japan, we spend time as a group doing much more:

  • Art Group/Doujinshi Creation
  • Restaurant and Boba Trips
  • Manga Store Visits
  • Gunpla and Model Building
  • Video and Board Games
  • Karaoke
  • Cosplay
  • Guest Speakers
  • Local Conventions
  • Group Trips
  • Theater Showings

Join Our Discord!

Current meetings are Saturday at 4:00 PM at Tech LR5
value.Summary: Come enjoy Anime, Japan's unique style of animation, with NU Anime Club. Experience the wealth of genres and styles that Anime has to offer and talk about it with us!

value.Name: Northwestern Bhangra Dance Team
value.Description: Passion, dedication, and talent united to form Northwestern Bhangra in 2006. An enthusiastic co-ed university dance team known for its energy on and off the stage, the troupe performs bhangra, a traditional folk dance originating in the Indian state of Punjab. The team has performed at numerous campus events, imprinted its name all over the Chicagoland area, and entertained the bhangra community across the nation. Throughout the years, the team has performed at prestigious competitions such as Bhangra in the Bell, Bhangra Blowout, Bhangra in the Burgh, Nachte Raho, and many others. As they continue to inspire others with their dynamic style, the bhangra team shares and celebrates Punjabi culture with the Northwestern community. Northwestern Bhangra is a true family, and they always animate the stage with personality and originality while remembering their traditional roots.
value.Summary: Founded in 2006, Northwestern Bhangra aims to promote awareness of Punjabi culture through dance. Since our founding, we have grown into a team that performs at events all around the Chicagoland area and at competitions across the nation.

value.Name: Northwestern Career Advancement
value.Description: The mission of Northwestern Career Advancement (formerly University Career Services) is to foster excellence in career development, preparation, and professional opportunity for undergraduate and graduate students and alumni by providing comprehensive services and programming and by promoting strong partnerships with employers, academic departments, and the university community.
value.Summary: The mission of Northwestern Career Advancement (formerly UCS) is to foster excellence in career development, preparation, and professional opportunity for undergraduate and graduate students and alumni by providing comprehensive services.

value.Name: Northwestern Chinese Christian Student Fellowship
value.Description:
We are a group of Chinese students, scholars and local families united by the Christian faith. We share the gospel and study Bible every Friday evening on Evanston campus. Our door is open to all.

If you want to know us and need help from us, please come to us on Friday night (6:30PM -- 9:30PM).

Welcome!!
value.Summary: We are a group of Chinese students, scholars and local families united by the Christian faith. We share the gospel and study Bible every Friday evening on Evanston campus. Our door is open to all.

value.Name: Northwestern Climate Technology Club
value.Description: CTC organizes student seminars, guest lectures, discussion groups, local company/startup/lab tours, and social outings for students. Our events focus on themes of climate tech, clean energy, environmental impacts, and resource management. We have about 10 officers on the board, and we are continually recruiting students to become members or join the board.  Please visit netg.northwestern.edu to learn more.
value.Summary: Climate Tech Club (CTC), formerly Northwestern Energy Technology Group, aims to advance the research and understanding of climate, energy, and sustainability technologies by providing educational and collaborative opportunities for Northwestern students.

value.Name: Northwestern Club Swim Team
value.Description:
Northwestern Swim Club was founded in 2008 providing a club swimming opportunity for undergraduate students at Northwestern. We practice three to four times a week at Norris Aquatics Center at SPAC. We typically go to two to three meets a quarter. We host our annual home meet during the beginning of winter quarter. Our competition season ends with a trip to CCS Nationals in early April. All swimmers are welcome to join, regardless of skill level!

 

Practice schedule:

 

Tentative Practice Schedule for Fall Quarter 2022:

Tuesday: 8:30PM-10:00PM 
Saturday: 4:00PM-6:00PM 
Sunday: 4:00PM-6:00PM 

One dryland session (time TBD, it depends on club member's availability)

 

Winter/Spring quarter 2021 Practice Schedule for Reference: 

Monday: 8:30PM-10:00PM 
Thursday: 8:30PM-10:00PM
Saturday: 4:00PM-6:00PM 
Sunday: 4:00PM-6:00PM 

One dryland session (time TBD, it depends on club member's availability)
value.Summary: Northwestern Club Swimming was founded in 2008 providing a club swimming opportunity for undergraduate students at Northwestern. We practice three to four times a week at Norris Aquatics Center at SPAC and attend meets throughout the year.

value.Name: Northwestern Community Development Corps
value.Description: Northwestern Community Development Corps (NCDC) is a student-run organization that seeks to engage students in community development at Northwestern University, in Evanston, and throughout Chicago. We promote civic engagement through direct service, social awareness, and advocacy. Utilizing existing skills, talents, and abilities, we strive to build mutually beneficial relationships, enriching both our campus and the communities, while forming a foundation for the future.
value.Summary: Northwestern Community Development Corps (NCDC) seeks to strength community through creating and maintaining mutually beneficial partnerships between and among Northwestern and its Evanston and Chicago neighbors.

value.Name: Northwestern Community Ensemble
value.Description: Founded in 1971, NCE is Northwestern's premier gospel choir who performs music in the Black Christian tradition. We seek to provide Northwestern's African American community as well as the broader Northwestern community opportunities to engage with Black culture, gospel music, and Christian faith through our concerts and other performances. Check out our most recent winter concert, featuring 2-time Grammy-award-winning gospel superstar Tye Tribbett, here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SRTK3SvOS8o&t=2711s
value.Summary: We are Northwestern's premier gospel choir founded in 1971 performing spiritual, gospel, and anthem music from the Black Christian tradition.

value.Name: Northwestern Crew
value.Description:
Northwestern Crew is a co-ed club sport that competes with other club and varsity programs throughout the county. We are an active team throughout the entire year with our main seasons in fall and spring and indoor training in winter. Practices take place at the Dammrich Rowing Center in Skokie during fall and spring season and at the Henry Crown Sports Pavilion during winter season.

While learning to row/cox and working on technique and speed, novice (new) rowers and coxswains will participate in 1 - 2 races in fall and 3 - 4 races in spring. The team takes a spring training trip during Spring Break to prepare for spring racing in Oak Ridge, TN.

Novice practices will take place weekday mornings and on selected weekends at the coaches' discretion. Racing takes place on the weekends as well.

Experienced rowers and coxswains are welcome to practice and race at varsity level. All are welcome!

Please contact Harper McIntyre: vwomenscaptain@northwesterncrew.com for all women’s team inquiries and Bruno Kraidy: vmenscaptain@northwesterncrew.com for all men’s team inquiries.
value.Summary: Northwestern Crew is a co-ed club sport that competes with other club and varsity programs throughout the county. We are an active team throughout the entire year with our main seasons in fall and spring and indoor training in winter.

value.Name: Northwestern Economics Tournament
value.Description:
The purpose of Northwestern Economics Tournament (NET) is to give high school students opportunities to explore the field of economics before entering college. We aim to introduce high school students to economics in a welcoming environment through competitions and interactive speaker events. NET also encourages the participation of Northwestern students, who plan and organize the event. 

We’re looking for students from all backgrounds who are passionate about economics and can think creatively about adapting NET to a permanent hybrid format as we look forward to a post-pandemic landscape. We also welcome students interested in high school education and event planning.
value.Summary: We are a small group of Northwestern students who organize an annual economics tournament for high school students from the Chicago area and around the country.

value.Name: Northwestern Financial Wellness
value.Description:
Managing personal finance can be a daunting task. The Office of Undergraduate Financial Aid is committed to educating and empowering Northwestern students to make informed decisions about money management. The Financial Wellness website helps to equip students with the knowledge and resources to manage their finances at Northwestern and beyond. Topics include:

Money 101: The basics of financial literacy and personal finance, including budgeting, banking, and credit.

Financial Planning: Prepare for life after Northwestern with information about retirement planning, tax help, and more.

Student Loan Management: Information and resources about loan repayment

Saving in College: Browse money saving tips and discounts available to NU students.
value.Summary: We encourage students to plan for anticipated expenses, prepare a budget, and consider the impact their financial decisions will have on their credit.

value.Name: Northwestern Flipside
value.Description:
Free Everywhere, $2.30 Canada

Like The Onion ? The Daily Show? The Colbert Report? The Northwestern Flipside is a satirical publication and official student group at Northwestern University. Founded in 2008, we make ~1000 people laugh, chuckle, and smile to themselves daily. We publish articles and headlines online each day, with bi-weekly print issues and occasional video, radio, and magazine content. All are welcome to contribute in any capacity possible. You can write, act, edit, or just attend meetings to throw out some topics or ideas. Come participate in one of the most fun groups on campus!

The Northwestern Flipside is a member of the Flipside News Network, which includes other satirical publications such as The Stanford Flipside, The USC Flipside, The Feinberg Flipside, The Deerfield Flipside, The Mizzou Flipside, The Flipside International and The NorShore News.

All names and quotes are made up unless a public figure is being satirized. Remember, these are all jokes.

 

Contact

If you would like to join The Northwestern Flipside, recommend an idea, submit an article, or have any questions, please email xanthebrown2023@u.northwestern.edu.

 

Links

Visit our official site to read past articles and find more information!

Check out our Facebook page here, and be sure to follow us on Twitter @realnuflipside!
value.Summary: The Northwestern Flipside is Northwestern University’s official satirical newspaper. We publish new content online daily, as well as monthly print issues distributed across campus. Visit our website at www.NorthwesternFlipside.com for more information!

value.Name: Northwestern Formula Racing
value.Description:
Formula SAE

Formula SAE (FSAE) is an intercollegiate engineering design competition organized by the Society of Automotive Engineers (SAE), where student teams design, build, and race formula-style cars. FSAE began in the USA in 1978, and now includes hundreds of international teams that compete in eight competitions around the world.

 

The FSAE series is internationally regarded as one of the most rigorous collegiate design competitions. Each year, teams spend 8 to 12 months preparing for competition.

 

The concept of the competition is for students to design, build, and race a prototype formula-style vehicle. The prototype is marketed towards the non-professional, weekend autocross racer. It must be high-performance, low cost, easy to maintain, and suitable for manufacture at 1000 units per year. Students manage all aspects of the project like a small business, from the technical design to the management of an interdisciplinary team.

 

Engineering

Teams have overwhelming freedom in the design of their cars. This is evident in the variety and ingenuity presented at each competition. Technical restrictions only exist to ensure safety, and do not limit creativity. Students engage a panel of industry judges to defend their design decisions with supporting analysis. Student drivers compete against the clock in a series of driving events to demonstrate real-world performance of their vehicles.

 

Business and Marketing

Building a racing car is not all engineering. Complex projects require strong leaders and a cooperative environment to succeed. In addition to managing the project, students must present a business case to a prospective manufacturer as well as a detailed manufacturing and cost analysis, showing complete understanding of what it takes to bring a product to market.

 

Perspective

FSAE converts classroom knowledge to real world experience. Involvement in the complete design process is a unique educational opportunity.
value.Summary: McCormick Student Group

value.Name: Northwestern Karate
value.Description:
Join us for karate and self-defense classes! All sessions are beginner-friendly!

Karate Classes:

Every Tuesday at  SPAC Studio 2 (2311 Campus Dr, Evanston, IL 60208)
     7:30-9:00 Studio: All Levels
 
Every Saturday at SPAC Studio 1A (2311 Campus Dr, Evanston, IL 60208)
     12:30-2:00 pm: Intermediate/Advanced Lessons 
     1:45-2:45 pm: New Beginners
 
Contact Austin (karate@u.northwestern.edu) for locations and more information.

Check out our club's Facebook page website: www.facebook.com/NUkarate

Are you interested in learning a traditional Japanese martial art? Strengthening your body as well as your mind? Having fun, making friends, and learning something new? Then check out Northwestern Karate! The club is open to students, faculty, staff, and other members of the Northwestern University community. The club teaches Shotokan karate two times a week at the Evanston campus. In addition, the club sponsors an annual collegiate competition, seminars, and social functions. No previous experience in martial arts is necessary to join the club, and beginners are always welcome. For those with previous experience, we welcome all practitioners of traditional Japanese karate. A number of the students and instructors are members of the AAKF/ITKF, but the club is open to members of other affiliations (ISKF, WKO, etc.) and unaffiliated dojos.
value.Summary: Are you interested in learning a traditional Japanese martial art? Strengthening your body as well as your mind? Having fun, making friends, and learning something new? Then check out Northwestern Karate Club!

value.Name: Northwestern News Network
value.Description: We are the only broadcast news station on Northwestern's campus. We produce, shoot and report for three weekly newscasts specializing in campus news, sports and politics. Our staff members shoot, edit, and anchor all of our content, and we often travel to cover news in Chicago and beyond. The shows are created for students, by students. The network has won many accolades including student news Emmys and Best All-Around Newscast from the Society of Professional Journalists.
value.Summary: NNN is the only broadcast news station on campus. We produce, shoot and report for three weekly newscasts specializing in campus news, sports and politics, in addition to our online platforms.

value.Name: Northwestern News Network-Sports
value.Description: We are the sports department of Northwestern's student television station. Our group produces our own sports television show which we shoot once a week. Our staff member shoot, edit, and anchor all of our content, and we often travel to road games.
value.Summary: We are the sports department of Northwestern's student television station. Our group produces our own sports television show which we shoot once a week. Our staff member shoot, edit, and anchor all of our content, and we often travel to road games.

value.Name: Northwestern NuTango
value.Description: NuTango is a Northwestern University student-run organization for Argentine Tango. We host lessons, practices, and dance events. NuTango is dedicated to provide a fun and friendly environment for beginners to start in Tango, as well for more experienced dancers to continue dancing. In our events, we strive to create an open environment that encourages members to explore the role of lead and follow. Additionally, we embrace musical variety by playing a wide range of songs from traditional Tango to modern. We are open to everyone in the Northwestern community as well as general public of Chicago area.
value.Summary: NuTango is a Northwestern University student-run organization for Argentine Tango. We host lessons, practices, and dance events.

value.Name: Northwestern Political Union
value.Description:
The Northwestern University Political Union (PU) is a community of students united by their common interest in discussion of political and global affairs. Bringing together students of various backgrounds, ideologies, and political persuasions, the Political Union aims to foster a revival of intellectualism, sincerity, and sophistication in Northwestern’s campus political discourse.

PU holds weekly meetings in a variety of formats, including student debates, lectures from faculty, discussions over dinner, and special guest speakers. All undergraduates are welcome at PU meetings and there is no membership fee to attend our events.
value.Summary:
The Northwestern University Political Union is a community of students united by their common interest in discussion of political and global affairs.

Visit http://www.nupoliticalunion.org/ for more information.

value.Name: Northwestern Public Health Review
value.Description: See more information at our website (https://sites.northwestern.edu/nphr/) and on our blog (https://nphr.wordpress.com/).
value.Summary: NPHR is a student-run academic journal. Our goal is to take you behind the scenes of public health and provide a simpler platform for students and faculty to share their public health perspectives, ideas, and original research.

value.Name: Northwestern Quest Scholars Network
value.Description: The Northwestern Quest Scholars Network (NUQSN) is Northwestern University's only low-income and first generation advocacy group. NUQSN serves over 20% of the Northwestern population as both a community and advocacy group for low-income and first generation students and their allies. NUQSN also serves as a resource for the Chicagoland grade school and high school communities, both mentoring underprivledged youth and educating low-income students about scholarship and educational opportunities at Northwestern and beyond.
value.Summary: NUQSN aims to create an engaged and supportive community for low-income and first-generation students as well as their allies in addition to ensuring equal opportunities for all low-income and first-generation students on Northwestern's campus.

value.Name: Northwestern Raas
value.Description: Northwestern Raas has been blending its passion for dance with a dedication to promoting awareness of South Asian culture since its founding in 2014. As the University’s premier co-ed Raas and Garba team, a dance form that originates in the Indian state of Gujarat, Northwestern Raas is known for its strong sense of community and enthusiasm both behind the curtain and on stage. The team has delighted audiences across the nation in multiple national competitions per year including Raas Royalty, Nasha, Raas Mania, and Pittsburgh Raaz. Northwestern Raas is more than just a college dance team — it’s a family, with a network of alumni, that continues to inspire, educate and engage those around them in the beauty of South Asian culture.
value.Summary: Northwestern Raas is the University's premier co-ed Raas and Garba team, a high-energy folk dance originating from the Indian state of Gujarat.

value.Name: Northwestern Sketch Television
value.Description: NSTV (Northwestern Sketch Television) is a College Emmy-award winning sketch comedy group from Northwestern University. The team, which includes over eighty students working in various positions, writes, directs, shoots, edits, promotes and acts in a wide variety of sketches throughout the year. In addition to making content for the Internet and an annual feature-length campus premiere, NSTV sponsors and performs in live shows and facilitates guest speakers, workshops and field-trips. Check us out at www.northwesternsketchtv.com!
value.Summary: NSTV (Northwestern Sketch Television) is a College Emmy-award winning sketch comedy group from Northwestern University. Including over eighty students working in various positions, we write, direct, shoot, promote, and act in a wide variety of sketches.

value.Name: Northwestern Swing Dance Syndicate
value.Description:
NSDS is an organization run out of the community building grant of the graduate school to promote stronger community via swing dancing - lindy hop, blues, balboa, and a range of other dances. We host lessons throughout the year, as well as organizing all-Chicago dance events, with nationally renowned swing bands. We are open to everyone in the Northwestern community, from beginners to advanced dancers. 

There are several ways to connect with us and the community of dancers that we have.

1) Facebook group is our most active mode of communication among our group within NU and broader Chicago area.

2) Our group has an email listserv where we send out information about dance classes and events on campus that we organize. Subscribe by sending an email to listserv@listserv.it.northwestern.edu with no subject and SUBSCRIBE NSDS in the body, or contact us directly and we'll help you out.

3) The club's official email address is nuswingdance@gmail.com. Send us requests, questions, suggestions, etc.

Hope to see you dancing with us!
value.Summary: Lindy Hop, East Coast, Charleston, and Balboa are what we do. We focus and promote social dancing with (new) friends by providing weekly dancing classes, quarterly dances with live band, and occasionally dance workshops.

value.Name: Northwestern Taekwondo
value.Description:
Northwestern Taekwondo Club is a community of students who love to kick!
